content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
												 Hatty Hattington and his friends were enjoying a nice sailboat ride when suddenly their vessel became caught in the middle of a serious storm. It crashed against the shore of a nearby island, and the survivors soon found themselves imprisoned by a race of giant cats that made their prisoners battle for their lives in a dilapidated theater. Meanwhile, Hatty watched in silence, sitting in a chair with a malevolently glowing top hat resting on his headThe story in BattleBlock Theater isn't especially memorable once you put aside the creepy imagery of homicidal cat people. What really sells the tale is the energetic narrator, who tears through one line after another of cheesy exposition littered with enough poop jokes to fill an adult diaper. Hopefully, you don't mind that sort of juvenile humor, or you're at least willing to look past it so that you can enjoy what is easily one of the most satisfying downloadable titles to arrive on the Xbox Live Arcade.If you've been playing 2D action platformers for years, one of the aspects you'll appreciate most about BattleBlock Theater is its refusal to hold your hand unnecessarily. The interface and objectives are designed to communicate their purpose clearly, so a tutorial is neither needed nor provided. All that you must do to win the game is reach your friend, which you do by clearing one portion of the theater after another. As you work toward that end, you explore more than 100 carefully constructed stages that put your platforming and puzzle-solving skills to the test.As each stage begins, you jump out of a cage that is positioned somewhere within an arena. Your specific goal is to pass through a glowing exit gate, but first you must collect a number of emeralds that are located somewhere in the vicinity. Collecting three of them is enough to do the job, but you can also gather additional ones to use as currency at theater gift shops. An oversized ball of yarn is also stashed in each zone--usually in a fiendishly clever place--and there are sometimes bonus stages that are hidden behind portions of the landscape in out-of-the-way places. Though you don't always work against a timer, you still want to hurry because completion time and any optional items gathered both count toward the letter grade that you are awarded upon completing a stage.You encounter new hazards and more demanding situations as you advance. Figuring everything out usually takes only a moment, and then negotiating the additional obstacles becomes second nature until you're faced with a particularly devious area and find yourself pausing to ponder the best course of action. Such moments come up quite often, since BattleBlock Theater can be quite the difficult game. By the time you're partway through the sixth chapter, you're wall jumping, dashing, sliding, and double jumping like a champion, and you still might not be able to avoid the buzzsaw blades, spike traps, and grenade-launching cats thrown your way.Fortunately, the normal difficulty setting includes a generous checkpoint system that prevents you from ever losing much ground. You can try your luck at some of the more challenging gauntlets a few times over the course of a minute, until you get everything right, and the feeling when you come out the other end is exhilarating. If you prefer a less forgiving system, try insane mode. It doesn't play a lot differently than its standard counterpart--until you die. Then, you have to collect all those gems and that pesky yarn ball all over again because there was no checkpoint to catch you when you fell. Considering how crazy things get by the end of the adventure, you'll likely be doing yourself a favor if you start with the easier default setting.Although the charismatic narrator and the thrill of each new stage are ample incentive to advance toward the closing credits, the developers also included a bunch of unlockable content that lets you personalize your experience. In addition to a variety of special attacks that include vacuum cleaners and exploding paper airplanes, you can choose from one of four head types for your character. That's a nice touch since the head makes up about half of the hero's body mass. Most of the available options are wonderfully zany; there's simple pleasure in watching a ragdoll with a giant, triangular head and curlers leap around an arena while launching fireballs and narrowly avoiding homing missiles fired by oversized robots.Personalized characters make sense in BattleBlock Theater, especially because the game features a robust selection of multiplayer modes. There are eight distinct events that place you in similar arenas with unique objectives. In one mode, you attack your foe to knock his soul loose so that you can carry it, while you avoid letting him do the same thing to you. The longer you possess your adversary's spirit, the more points you accrue. In another attraction, you must tag more blocks than your opponent does within the provided time limit. There's also a mode where you grab a ball and score hoops on your opponent's goal, while in yet another selection, you ride your rival's steed back to your goal to score points. You can also work with possible allies to complete stages, and even take a break from the action to trade collectibles with friends.Multiplayer modes allow as many as four people to participate at once either locally or online, but it's also possible to interact with other players less directly. The game includes an intuitive level editor. A tutorial is included, but you'll barely even need it if you've already played through the game. You select dimensions for your desired arena, then place blocks and objectives as you see fit. Once you create a "playlist" that contains three stages, you can upload your creation and other players may vote it up or down. Your creation could even be featured as a top-rated community selection if enough people like what you've done. Though there aren't as many creation and sharing options as you'd find in something like Little Big Planet, the tools could keep you and others entertained for hours.Even if you find BattleBlock Theater too challenging after the initial stages, you'll want to keep playing just so you can see where the story goes next, or because you're every bit as addicted to the platforming action as expert players are. There's no shortage of ways to play, whether that be alone, cooperatively, or competitively, and the capable level editor is the icing on the cake. Hatty Hattington and his friends may be living through an absolute nightmare, but you're bound to be so thoroughly entertained that you won't have time to empathize.The Good    Hilarious narration    Challenging, freewheeling platforming    Extensive multiplayer options enhance the nuttiness    Intuitive content creation    Lots of great, expertly crafted levelsThe Bad    Juvenile humor can occasionally grate8.5    Great

												From the developers of Castle Crashers comes yet another warp and twisted adventure involving prisoners, blocks, and nefarious cat overlords. You will be enslaved by the game's charm and demand all of your friends start playing this game right meow. Play alone or online or with your friend sitting next to you, in any form, the game is extremely fun and never stops leaving a grin on my face. It only took like two years for this to come from Xbox 360 to Steam but it seems much longer. The wait was worth it and I am happy to finally play it.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												Battleblock Theater, Man I remember when I saw the trailer for it before its release and pre-orderd it.And I don't regret it, It's like buying food in a grocery store and you buy something you hate to eat.Battleblock Theater is a platformer made by Behemoth, also known as the developers of another great indie title named Castle Crashers.If you don't want spoilers, don't continue reading beyond this point! It might ruin the game for you. And that isn't fun at all! Before I tell you a bit about the game, please grab a blanket to keep yourself warm as I tell you a bit of a story as kind as a mother's kiss. You'r a part of a crew on the ship S.S friendship. You and all your friends on board leave your town to go on another exciting adventure on the S.S friendship. But something horrable happens. A storm hits the ship and its not very happy to you and you'r friends. The storm strands the S.S Friendship on a unknown island with a building looking like a theater. Where did your friends go? Where are you? What exacly happend after the storm? And most important of all, where is hatty? You gotta find that out yourself, by playing a cruel act in the theater! Pros:+ The StoryIt migt not be the best of storys out there, but its good enough to keep you going. It fits with the games style.+ The NarratorThe Narrator of BBT (Battleblock Theater) is constantly with you through out the game, telling you what happend in the past, talking about what might happen ahead and even commenting about you dying.  ("Congratulaions, upon dying!") + The MusicIt might not be the best of music in games but, it fits the games style. It's quite unique compared to other games.+ Online Game modes And Online Co-OpMan, this game is way more fun with a friend, it was fun before but its even more fun with a friend in co-op story mode or just having you and 3 friends playing other game modes. Like capturing a pig to score points for the team or play basket or just fight to the death.++ Furbottom's FeaturesThis is the area where you acces other game modes, and aswell where you can play custom made maps from the steam workshop, there are maps for evrey game mode. Some are recreatios of the story mode but for 4-players. Some are just for you and a friend platforming along a series of levels in a playlist. This gives the game so much more life and you can have almost have endless amount of fun.Cons:- The Short StoryAlright it ain't that short but sometimes I wished it was a bit longer. And most likely when you beat the game you'r either gonna do it again on hard mode or play it on normal mode with a friend.Well there aren't many more cons I can think off. I like the game really much and if you have a chance to play it, I strongly recommend itI give this game a 8.5/10

Posted: May 24, 2014
												Fun little platformer with or without friends. So much content, so much fun. Even when you're done the game, theres an extra gamemode for an insane mode, the same tracks but ALOT harder. You can also get A++'s in the ones you didn't. You can download extra maps to play, and the hosting for this game is AMAZING. Just start a friends lobby and BAM. They can connect via steam, it's actually wonderful. Every friday there is a new featured map to unlock a head. It makes it so you have a purpose to keep playing. Theres TONS of different gamemodes, over at least 10 in Arena alone. It's puzze gets from an extreme platformer such as super meat boy with it's parkour and timing, to where do I go and confusing situations. It'd probably take so long to 100% it, that's why it's replay value is some of the best I've seen. And I FINALLY got it when it first came out so I get all of the limited time only stuff >:D

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												Being the emotionally dead person I am, the kind who barely gets a laugh out of anything, Battleblock Theatre was a pleasant surpise. A game thats actually funny and doesn't just curb in pop culture refrences in an effort to get cheap laughs. *cough cough* Borderlands *unconvicing cough*. But being sprinkled with excellent humor wouldn't stop a game from being♥♥♥♥♥♥if the gameplay was♥♥♥♥♥♥ and luckily Battleblock's gameplay isn't♥♥♥♥♥♥ Its a fast paced platformer broken up into a series of chapters with 9 levels, 2 time trial levels which are basically the finale that allows you to go to the next chapter, and 3 optional levels to allow you to make some more gems, which allow you to purchace diffrent kinds of heads to customize your character, on the side. The levels are all amazingly well designed with loads of challenging bits and puzzels that managed to stump me atleast, but  to be honest it's probably because i'm thick as an asphalt milkshake when it comes to puzzels. The game builds up a brillant atmosphere and feel and manages to maintain it the whole way through. Oh yeah theres also multiplayer, but since I'm super lonley, and theres barely ever any open games available for some reason,  i wasn't able to test it out to a great extent, but i did play enough to figure out that its not like alot of games where other players seem unnecessary, nothing but a  usless tag along that does nothing except consume space, time and in some cases health and ammo. But its also not like alot of other games where the campaign was exclusivly designed for multiplayer but has a single player campaign, so if you're not playing on multiplayer it leads to you fighting way to many enemies and having an excess of supplies that were meant for you're friends. The levels actually get tweaked slightly depending on what mode you're on. On singleplayer the level, puzzles and all, are designed to be completed on singleplayer, while on multiplayer, everything is tweaked slightly to make you work together and rely on eachother for help. But you can attack the person you're playing with, including you're own team mates on one of the many, intresting battle modes, which will probably lead to some ruined friendships. So thats Battleblock Theater, an intresting little platformer, sprinkled with genuinely funny humor that i reccomend to all.

												Buckle your pants because BattleBlock Theater is one of the greatest platformers you will ever play.Its iconic gameplay takes platforming elements from the notorious "Super Meat Boy," and combines them with the challenging puzzles similar to "Portal."This game will take you on a wild ride as you collect gems with your friends in order to free the bestest friend of all: Hatty Hattington, who has been corrupted by a mysterious, evil hat on an island full of, erm, cats.If the story hasn't sold you yet, then I must inform you that this game has excellent replayability. content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
												Let me adress the game's bad qualities first: The fact that even if you can't get into a server, it will stay up on the list of servers you can get on is pretty annoying to have to deal with. I'm not sure if it happens to other people, but it happens to me and my friends all the time. The only other complaint I have is that they stopped updating the game as much as they did, but I understand that they have to work on other games. Besides those simple things, the game is pretty interesting and hilarious. There's funny cutscenes and even when you do something as simple as getting a gem (the in-game currency) the narrator will say something hilarious. It also has a great story that I haven't actually seen much, but I'm not going to spoil what it is. The game also has good party games, like Ball Game, King Of The Hill, and more. It even has a level editor, which is supported by the steam workshop. So, this game is great for everyone out there who loves a good videogame storyline, level editors, and party games.(I Also Chose This Game For The "Villian That Just Needs A Hug" Award In The Steam Awards.)

Posted: February 16, 2015
												 Battleblock Theater is an 2D platformer-puzzle game created by the legendary Behemoth.   In the main story mode, there are 8 chapters, each with 9 normal stages, a 2-part finale, and 3 encore stages. In the normal stages, you must find at least three green gems and reach the exit in time. Each one you complete unlocks the next one, and the final one unlocks the finale. In the finale, you're racing against the clock. You still need three gems in the first part, though I'm not positive about the second. May as well collect them, just to be sure! You have to do these two stages back-to-back, you can't select one individually. Which is a little annoying when you've only missed the A++ grade on one of them, and aren't positive you even got it until after you've finished both and checked. The encores are all unlocked at the same time after the finale is completed. These are basically timed, more challenging normal stages, and are completely optional. But, you know. Do 'em.There are plenty of other modes besides just rolling through the basic story mode by yourself. There's also an insane mode which forces you to start the entire level if you die even once! Did I mention there's an achievement in it, for you? There's also a co-op story. That also has an insane mode, in case there's anybody left in your life that you don't completely hate, yet (Stamper notwithstanding)! There's also an arena, which has eight different gametypes, including a fun sort of basketball game, a race to finish a level first, one where you have to rub up on all the tiles to change them to your team's color (my personal favorite), and of course just plain ol' beating the crap out of each other!You can, of course, play community-built stages, as well, in single player, co-op, AND arena varieties. These don't get you gems (the currency for unlocking new prisoners) or yarn (the currency for unlocking new weapons) unless they're featured, but they'll help ease the shakes you'll get when you're jonesing for a BattleBlock fix.BattleBlock's difficulty is fair, and has a good learning curve. The music is all pretty groovy and gives you something easily worth listening to as you step on that obvious trap and die like an idiot.Pro´s: + Extremely creative and fun level & puzzle design+ Slick gameplay with precise controls+ Fantastic humor+ Easy to create servers+ Great co-op and multiplayer modes+ Editor with Steam Workshop integration+ Character customizationCon´s:- Few very minor bugs, barely worth mentioning- Overall rating: Is a 14/15 (Must Own!)

number of helpful: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Когда ты говоришь BBT, то обычно мало кто понимает о чём ты, пока собственно он в этот BBT не поиграет.BattleBlock Theater стал той игрой, в которую ты можешь затащить любого человека с любыми игровыми вкусами. Это платформер, который придётся по душ любому, т.к. он прост в освоении и прохождение. Тут наверное заиграет что то внутри хардокрищиков, говорящие из глубин их мозга: "Да как вообще можно создавать платформер в котором ты не будешь постоянно умирать?". А вот так вот. Первое: В BBT ты постоянно умираешь. Постояяно. Второе: нужен хардкор - всё просто: включи режим "Хардкор".Как уже говорилось выше, игрушка представляет из себя ненапряжный платформер, с полным, кооператвным прохождением. Стоит отметить что 1 игру пройти реально, но это  не доставить столько удовольствия, поскольку игра сильно ориентирована на кооперативное прохождение и для этого созданы все условия (и ачивки). Нужно кинуть друга на другой берег? -Делай подсадку. Не нужно кидать друга на другой берег? -Делай подсадку. Нужно достать золотой клубок на другой части карты? -Делай подсадку. Хочешь потерять друга? -...(думаю сами поняли).В игре так же есть какое - никакое ПвП в виде арен или соревновательных мини - игр, но про них я расписывать не буду, т.к. никогда не пробовал. Игра полностью поддерживает workshop что не может не радовать. Прошёл всю игру? Пройди ещё несколько десятков тысяч уровней, созданных пользователями! (Кстати ещё один плюсик в копилку хардкорщиков. От хардкорщиков, для хардкорщиков). Редактор уровней прост до невозможности - это развязывает руки многим пользователям.В игре присутствуют класные фичи по типу кастомизации и оружия. Кастомизация тут ограничивается выбором типа головы и её формы. Хоть это и единственный способ украсить персонажа (Здесь я опустил выбор цвета игрока), но его вполне хватает, учитывая что тут несколько сотен этих голов, которые надо ещё и открыть, а играете вы в конце концов в платформер, а не в sims (тут могла быть шутка про кастомизацию современных MMORPG, но её не будет). Следующий пункт - оружие. Его тут около 20 видов. Оно нужно для того что бы изничтожать (какое хорошее слово) котов. Либо что бы  помогать себе и товарищу проходить уровень. Или же что бы мешать. Или же что бы мешать товарищу проходить, изничтожая котов. Либо же что бы изничтожать товарищей, попутно мешая котам проходить вас. И т.п. (ну вы поняли)Структура уровней тут везде одинаковая: На карте расположен выход, который открывается когда вы соберёте 3 гема (гема, потому что огранённый изумруд - длинное словосочитание). Всего на карте от 6 до 7 этих гемов (редко - 5). Собирать их или нет - на ваше усмотрение. Так же на уровне всегда присутствует 1 золотой клубок. Обычно он запрятан в каком - нибудь труднодоступном месте. Зачем собственно всё это нужно? Ну во первых за прохождение уровня вы получаете оценку по пятибальной шкале от A до F. Так же есть A++ но что бы выбить эту оценку нужно умудриться собрать всё на уровне, да ещё и уложиться во время, которые тут в принципе не ограничено кроме финальных уровней глав (об это чуть позже). За гемы можно покупать головы - по 10 за шт. При чём голова даётся рандомно. Вы выбираете только её форму (Шар, куб, цилиндр, пирамида). После 10 купленных голов одной формы цена возрастает до 15 за шт. Золоты клубки тратятся на покуупку новых оружий, по 5 клубков за шт. К слову все виды оружий открыть куда проще, чем все головы.Теперь немного о прохождении самой игры. Игра делится на 8 глав. После прождения каждой главы вам открывается доступ е следующей, и рассказывается часть сюжета (Да, это платформер с сюжетом). В каждой главе 9 основных, 2 финальных и 3 дополнительных уровня. По поводу основных уровней всё описано выше. Финальные уровни, схожи с обычными, но у вас всегда есть ограничение по времени, по истичению которого вы проваливаете прохождение уровня. Дополнительные уровни устроены по принципу финальных, но для того что бы открыть следующую главу проходить их необязательно.Отдельно стоит отметить саундтреки к игре. ЭТО ШЕДЕВР! Я никогда не слышал ничего более подходящего для платформера, чем данные произведения искусства. Не буду больше ничего говорить, это просто надо слышать.Игра очень часто светится на распродажах по 69 р., хотя свою полную стоимость игра окупает.Вроде всё сказал, не думаю что многие прочли до конца, но спасибо за внимание!P.s: В игре много шуток про♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥br>P.p.s: Мне просто нужно было написать обзор для значка

content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												BattleBlock Theater is a game filled with death and cats. it is also pretty good at ruining friendships. after completing the game by myself for the first time, i felt the desire to go back and play again, this time on the hardest difficulty. This game also has lots of head faces for the prisoners that you pay for with gems, and weapons you pay for with yarn. this game gave me a desire to go back and collect all the heads as well. As for the co op mode. BattleBlock Theater's co op mode can be fun, boring, aggrivating, it just depends on who you play with. There are people who will constantly kill you, and there is people who will be trying to help get through the levels and not kill at all. just make sure you play insane co op with a person who wants to finish the level. There is also an arena mode if you are tired of the game's campaign. you can play games like, basketball, gold grab, capture the horse, soul snatcher, and more. BattleBlock Theater also features community levels that are made by the community and a level creater. So if you are tired of their boring levels, shut up and do it better : )BattleBlock Theater is also filled with lots of fun and enjoyable characters and cutscenes that are bound to put a smile on your face at least once through the game. This game's replay value is great and it has very addictive gamplay to keep you going for hours. I say if you haven't played BattleBlock Theater yet, what are you waiting for? I reccomend this game for anyone looking for a platformer that provides a fun experience and story.10/10

												Legitimately funny on its own, with plenty of content both official and community-contributed, but it becomes a thing of hilarious beauty when played with a friend, especially for local co-op. Screw each other over in the most amusing ways you can think of, or just by accident, it calls to mind Portal 2 for the kind of co-op shenanigans you can get up to. Eventually you'll have to call a truce as you traverse the increasingly difficult levels, set to silly, catchy tunes and delightfully narrated by the silliest of people who may or may not be even following the script.

												As a Beta Tester of this game, I can safely say that the bugs of this game have been worked out. Fantastic work on the port, Behemoth.The game itself is hillarious and fun. The online works flawlessly, easy to join and doesn't lag as badly as castle crashers did (on bad connections, at least.) The voice acting and writing is the best. Gameplay plays exactly like you'd want a side scrolling puzzle platformer hybrid to play, and the music is incredibly catchy. The art style, while slightly low res in some areas, fits the humor perfectly.The game clocks around 8 hours of play at best, but not counting the endless matches you'll be playing online or with a friend by your side. It's definately worth the price tag and then some.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												BattleBlock Theater is one of the funniest games I've played. The game takes place in a deserted theater that is now overrun by cats. After your boat crashes the cats kidnap your best friend Hatty and force him into running the theater. You and all of your other friends are now prisoners being forced to perform for the audience that will pay a good amount of gems to see you get destroyed in any way possible. To complete a level you must evade all the obstacles and collect gems along the way, until you reach the exit (Note: The exit will only open if you have collected three gems or more) Like I said before this games story is hilarious but that doesn't mean the game itself is all that soft. No, the difficulty grows higher and higher until you get mad of seeing your character blow up, drown, get pierced by spikes and get eaten. The closest i can compare, in the case of despicable enemy/trap placement, is Mega Man. But don't worry your not just some helpless little performer, because you get to carry two of many insane weapons that may come in handy to kill something or to reach some areas. Control wise this game has really responsive and tight controls, but it would be best to play with a controller and not your keyboard. The multiplayer part of the game is fantastic, you can play through the story with a friend or get four people together to play a new form of basketball or challenge each other  by creating your own levels in the level creator.This game is great for when you just want to try something different that’s  fun but at the same time challenging, so if you have money and you dont know what to do with it I really suggest buying BattleBlock Theater.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												BattleBlock Theater is one of the funniest games I've played. The game takes place in a deserted theater that is now overrun by cats. After your boat crashes the cats kidnap your best friend Hatty and force him into running the theater. You and all of your other friends are now prisoners being forced to perform for the audience that will pay a good amount of gems to see you get destroyed in any way possible. To complete a level you must evade all the obstacles and collect gems along the way, until you reach the exit (Note: The exit will only open if you have collected three gems or more) Like I said before this games story is hilarious but that doesn't mean the game itself is all that soft. No, the difficulty grows higher and higher until you get mad of seeing your character blow up, drown, get pierced by spikes and get eaten. The closest i can compare, in the case of despicable enemy/trap placement, is Mega Man. But don't worry your not just some helpless little performer, because you get to carry two of many insane weapons that may come in handy to kill something or to reach some areas. Control wise this game has really responsive and tight controls, but it would be best to play with a controller and not your keyboard. The multiplayer part of the game is fantastic, you can play through the story with a friend or get four people together to play a new form of basketball or challenge each other  by creating your own levels in the level creator.This game is great for when you just want to try something different that’s  fun but at the same time challenging, so if you have money and you dont know what to do with it I really suggest buying BattleBlock Theater.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Love platforming? Humor? CO-OP? Murdering your friends in cold blood? Then this is the game for you!BattleBlock Theater, ton's of fun and well worth it a thousand times over if you get in on sale! It's a blast with your friends, smashing and mostly killing eachother, and getting badscores on levels!But you only have a few hours, how could you even know? ♥♥♥♥ off, I'm a wizard. "But I'm a worthless sac of♥♥♥♥♥♥ who should really stop taking chemo so I die faster and make everyone happier and possibly would save the effort of me having to kill myself later, and I have no friends to play this game with!" exclaims Neckbeard Cancerface (and other low lifes like him). Well your in luck! Not only is this game good in multiplayer, but the single player is also tons of fun! With a different level set so you can complete it by your lonely self, you'll be crying (because you have no friends) but also because you are having so much fun!Now, what is the story you even ask? The most serious of stories, of course. To begin: You and your best friends, the most notable of all would of course be Hatty Hattington are going on an adventure on your ship S.S Friend...ship? And you have the worst of fates! You've crashed on an island and you have been captured and stuff, and you must perform!This game has been a blast so far, and honestly it's one of the best games, same with Castle Crashers and the other....one.I would honestly give this a good hearty 10/10, because it's challenging and fun!

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												I was honestly really skeptical of BattleBlock Theater in the beginning, but I had to buy it simply because of the trailer. I have played through the story on co-op and have gotten all As and A+s except for one B. Let me be the first to say I was absolutely wrong to be skeptical. This game got my expectations, blew them out of the water, caught them, pooped on them, then punched them into spikes and lava. It is an absolutely amazing game to play co-op. I would recommend getting this game even if you do not enjoy platformers, though I would suggest getting someone to play it with. Single player is still very fun.Pros:-Difficult levels. They start easy but get much harder later on.-Co-op is fun and works well for the most part (will explain in cons).-Steamworks and player-created levels.-Smooth controls and very easy to learn.-Nice controller support.-Good and well-made game mechanics, but still very silly and enjoyable.-Some gems and yarn (collectibles) are difficult to find and get.-A lot of different faces to unlock.Cons:-Keyboard controls aren't the best, but are tolerable. (Me and my girlfriend went through all of co-op, her on a keyboard, so very much doable and tolerable, but controller is recommended)-Boulders. If you are playing with an internet friend that is relatively far from you (probably 100-150 ms), the non-host can sometimes be killed by simply picking up a boulder and doing nothing with it. -Yarn becomes useless after a while. It is used to purchase weapons, but you can buy all of your weapons by chapter 5 or so.-Not a lot of replay value aside community maps.-Some weapons are essentially useless, but can still be fun to mess around with.Overall 9.5/10. One of the most enjoyable games I have played in a long while. It's honestly just pure, straight fun. Especially when I can punch my girlfriend into spikes.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2014
												Great & funny platformer. The solo campaign could be compared to Super Meat Boy except it's not as merciless and doesn't require that much incredible precision. Don't be fooled by the easy first chapters, it does crank up the difficulty around the middle of the game. There's also puzzle influences with lots of levels utilizing switches. The co-op campaign seemed fun too, with hilarious friendly fire accidents. The arena modes induced lots of yelling with the 2v2 local multiplayer modes that were more like chaotic brawler games instead of skilled platforming. Since there's an editor built-in you can play random assortments of uploaded levels if you find the official levels dull.In addition to the gameplay, the main draw of the game is the comedy side. The story makes no sense but it's really entertaining, mostly thanks to the narrator. The cartoony animated artstyle is great (very similar to Castle Crashers), the soundtrack is awesome and the excellent constant narrator quips make everything funny. There's hundreds of stupid looking unlockable heads to collect. Check the Steam store trailer to see if the game's particular style of wacky lolrandom crazy works for you.As a pure platformer I'd most likely gotten bored before finishing the game, but the cartoony aesthetics carried it and I finished the main story because every raving cutscene after a chapter is a treat. The 4-person couch arena chaos is a fine addition to Broforce and Gang Beasts evenings.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
												If for nothing else's Stamper's sense of humor makes this game a must buy.I feel the reason I enjoyed the game so much is seeing how insane and difficult it gets over time. Then when you get to the final chapter, everything requires lots and lots of timing. Some parts felt like a trail-and-error game play to get through the level, but other times had you sit and examine how to best complete a task in an individual level.The music was great and I loved the end game songs too.As for challenging, playing up some levels on the Steam Workshop or the bonus levels is always a nice way to test your skill.I think my favorite part is the huge cat motif the game carries, cats, cats as far as any furball can see.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												Killing your friends has never been this fun. Punch them into death lasers, freeze them and then shove them into water, or feed them to a giant raccoon monster. This zany platformer bursting at the seams with action, puzzles that aren't too difficult, tons of unlockable heads and weapons, and nonsensical arena modes that will put you to the test is no doubt one of the most fun and enjoyable games I've played in a long time. The comedy is what would be expected if you've played Castle Crashers; if you haven't played it, all you need to know is that the narration is full of just enough hilarity to keep you laughing the entire time.In other words: Holy♥♥♥♥♥♥ Pick up this game now.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												Usually, I wait until I finish the single-player game to put out a review of a game. But I just had a co-op game with a relative of mine, and what I played was enough to clinch a recommendation out of me.This is Super Meat Boy lite - much smaller levels, much scaled back in terms of difficulty and without uber-hardcore gymnastic moves you have to pull to pass the levels (except for the ♥♥♥♥ing double-jump. Grrrrr.). Usually when a game goes "It's like (insert game name here), but easier!", it usually ends up playing like a damp squib, like a pat on the back and a reassurance that you are totally good at video games! Not so with Battleblock Theater. It has smaller levels, but they are more creatively designed, do more with their set of tricks, and the game itself has tons more atmosphere - mostly in the form of the Narrator, who makes silly quips to egg me on to continue playing. They could have ♥♥♥♥ed up and made him immensely irritating. But the writing and the delivery of said wrting straddles between irritating and flat, hitting the sweet spot between the two.And, most importantly - they've made different sets of levels for single and co-op experiences, which is all I need to recommend a co-op game to other people. Seriously, have you seen some of these co-op games? They pretend to have single player modes, but those modes are actually the co-op modes with a huge amount of restraint to keep from screaming "YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY WITH OTHER PEOPLE? WHY NOT GO BACK TO READING BOOKS, YOU BIG DUMB FAT DORK, AND LEAVE THESE COOL VIDEO GAMES TO THE HIP FRIEND-HAVERS." The fact that the developers actually bothered to create campaigns to differentiate between the two is an automatic recommendation by itself. Kudos, The Behemoth. Battleblock Theater is the game for co-op hating people who want to play the game without friends, and then play later with friends if they so choose!

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												My first views on the game were slightly muddled being relatively new to steam and 'indie' games but after watching some online (multiplayer) gameplay my attention was drawn to the lay out (format) of the maps and challenges that followed. Alongside the fact I had heard it was an amazing game on the internet and through friends was what lead me to get BattleBlock Theatre.Positives:- Fantastic, interesting yet hilarious plot.- A wide variety of characters and powers/weapons achievable.- Each map is designed differently with chalanges such as fighting 'cats' and walking 'toast'.- There is always an aim/task at hand from completing maps on 'insane mode' to completing 'Furbottem's Features'.- How one uses the gems and balls of yarn they have collected through maps to buy new characters and weapons.- Online with friends is great with teamwork and completing maps causing much satisfaction.- Fubottem's Features is a great ad on with a much wanted character as the prize for completing the specific chapter.Negatives:- There are only 8 chapters. At least make it 10!- As much as it is a great game for many the £10.99 pound price tag on steam may be too much. To conclude I think by far the positives in BBT out match the negatives. It is by a mile my favourite platform and indie game of 2014. The 28 hours I have played so far have been unbelievably fun having completed all 8 chapters of the plot and Furbottom's Features.

content:
Posted: October 19, 2014
												I'd say this is another great hit from The Behemoth! It's a very intense platformer, particularly if you've got a "go big or go home" attitude like myself and try to do hardcore mode. The difficulty progression is fairly cozy; it doesn't hold your hand, but eventually you're going to have to do quite a bit of thinking to try and get some decent scores. Absolute tons of character heads to get if you're a customization-savvy person, as well as several weapons to use, although they aren't as useful as I'd like them to be. Trying to get those perfect scores and find the hidden gems gets really tough, but you feel pretty accomplished once you find them all and can still speed your way through the level fast enough. Co-op is really fun as well, with different challenges so you can enjoy a whole new world of levels with a friend.The voice acting is phenomal, as I would expect from Stamper. The story-line is fairly light, but still hilarious with said VA. Music isn't something I usually comment on, as I don't really pay attention to it for whatever reason, but I really enjoyed the sound-track. Various songs on each of the levels,Graphically, it's pretty similar to any of The Behemoth's other games; not to say that's a bad thing. It's very good, with plenty of dynamic animations everywhere to keep your attention to what's going on. As usual, a nice, clean, consistent look to it, and overall looks great.TL;DR - If you enjoy challenging but rewarding platformers, and are looking for something new and interesting, I definitely recommend Battleblock Theater.

												One of my most favorite games to date, and is one of the few who has 100% completed the game and has all heads; including all the special heads.The gameplay notoriously difficult, especially in the insane modes of both solo and co-op. But, in the end, it was well worth it; as long you're patient, stay calm and persistent in at least finishing the campaign.Has a really nice story, though I don't want to spoil it if you haven't played through the campaign completely.Highly recommend for people who likes to fight through the frustration. number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
												BattleBlock Theatre is a bright looking, challenging 2D platformer that doesn't take itself to serious.Story:You and your friends get stranded, and somehow you end up being imprisoned in a theatre by a bunch of cats.The goal is to free Hatty Hattington by performing your way through the theatre.The narrator with all of it's sarcastic comments and humor often cheered me up.GameplayYou can either play this solo or in co-op mode with up to 3 friends.I did enjoy the solo mode, but seeing a friend gifted this to me so we could play together I've mostly played co-op with him, and I don't regret it at all: We had a blast!~On normal modes you can activate checkpoints and have an infinite amount of lives... You can also push other people around, annoy them by trapping and, well, killing them.Especially when you're also talking on teamspeak (For me the in-game voicechat had some kind of annoying echo) you sometimes can't stop laughing due to failing/seeing the other fail, push them off once they finally make it, etc. etc.Seeing most levels don't have a time limit. and there's no game-over, you don't have to feel guilty about it either: There's no consequence whatsoever, except that they have to run back from whatever the last safepoint was.There are a LOT of ways to customise your character: With the gems you collect in the levels you can buy heads in a certain shape, though it's always a surprise how the head you get will look like.You can also buy weapons: There's a firebolt that sets monsters, and friends, on fire. The downside is that they can spread the fire.There's an iceblockcannon that, well, turns things into iceblocks.My favourite weapon was a frog with a hat... That'd run around until he explodes.OverallAn awesomely fun platformer with a perfect sense of humor you just have to give a try.Wether you enjoy the story mode, or mess around in one of the other modes, you are almost guaranteed to have a good time!http://backlogbattle.blogspot.nl/2016/01/battleblock-theatre.htmlPlease also check out Completing the Backlog's Curator page here - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
 BattleBlock Theater®  Great arcade game creators of Castle Crashers with a combination of platformer and puzzle game. The plot is simple and very funny, told by a narrator. In the game, we get on a mysterious island inhabited by evil cats, which are holding their prisoners that they took part in a deadly performances. Our goal is to survive and make it through to the grand final. The game features single player, co-op and two difficulty levels, normal and insane. The Arena features online co-op or versus in nine different modes. You can also play the levels made by other players or create your własnt track with obstacles. In the game you can also unlock new characters and weapons for diamonds or yarn balls collected during the game. Battleblock is a great production, a great voice of the narrator, brilliant soundtrack, beautiful and colorful graphics and great controls make this game really good game. In my opinion this is one of the best platform games I've ever played and what I am able to recommend.

YouTube™ Video: AlphaLegion Review: BattleBlock Theatre (Steam Edition) 

			Views: 1,070		

			SUBSCRIBE! = http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=alphal3gion Patreon = https://www.patreon.com/alphal3gion Follow me on Twitter = https://twitter.com/ALPHAL3GION PushStartPlay =...		

Battleblock Theatre is an incredibly enjoyable platformer that is enjoyable both solo or co-op. The Steam integration with it is fairly unique for a third-party title and allows a new way of building your collection of prisons and your arsenal, although the ability to import your own custom heads makes the market feel slightly redundant if you use it. The level creator allows for endless replay-ability with the Steam workshop, and the brilliant narration just seal’s the deal and adds to the overall charm of the game.Summary:+ Charming art style.+ Fantastic writing and narration.+ Great Steam integration.+ Brilliant co-op mode.+ Great level editor.- Custom content makes Steam integration feel redundant.- Combat feels slightly clunky.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												BattleBlock Theater made its debut in 2013, where it was released on the Xbox Live Marketplace. Finally coming to the PC in 2014, nothing has really been added to the core formula. However, the presentation is still wacky and irreverent; the platforming remains fun, and the level-editor is just as approachable as ever. Combine this with Steam Workshop integration, and you have a cute platformer that will keep you and your friends entertained for quite sometime.Hatty Hattington, glorious leader and “best friend to one and all”, leads a crew of mates with humourously-shaped heads aboard the SS Friendship. That’s right - a ship, filled with friends. Friendship. Even after this very first, very blunt joke, it becomes almost unsurprisingly obvious that Castle Crashers masterminds The Behemoth are behind 2D puzzle-platformer BattleBlock Theatre, as they serve up some familiar slapstick♥♥♥♥♥tongue-in-cheek banter the way they know best: via garish and whimsical characters, button bashing brilliance, and diarrhea-infused humour. After a tumultuous voyage across the ocean, the SS Friendship runs aground on a mysterious uncharted island run by evil cats. Brought to life by the amazing narration of Will Stamper, we learn that the peninsula is controlled by a colony of nasty prison-keeping cats, hellbent on abducting the ship’s remaining crew, and pitting them against a series of twisted challenges for their amusement within a makeshift theatre. Placing their trust in Hatty to save the day, the crew are amazed to discover he has flipped allegiances, but do become inherently suspicious of the evil-looking, yet entirely stylish, glowing red tophat he has forcibly acquired since crash landing on the island.This rather bizarre setup paves way for the hundreds of levels, which make up the majority of the game. The theater motif finds its way into the game’s layout as well; worlds (which are referred to as acts) are composed of nine or so individual levels (stages), and each world ends with a ‘finale’ level. Each level plays out on a theater stage, with catlike silhouettes creeping in the foreground, standing in for a ‘virtual’ audience. It’s all window dressing, sure, but this attention to detail and unwavering dedication to keep the player engaged is what makes BattleBlock Theater stand out from the rest of the platforming pack. It’s ironic given how creative the setup is that the actual gameplay is simple, but what BattleBlock Theater might lack in novel mechanics and flashy gameplay is made up for with tight controls and excellent level design. Every level is laid out on what is essentially a grid, with various block types making up the floors and walls you maneuver your little avatar on. Some blocks might launch the character into the air or explode after a second or two, while others allow them to climb up or slide down walls. It’s actually quite impressive how much level variety the developers have managed to curate with a fairly limited set of tools, but the game’s nuance and depth becomes more apparent the deeper into the campaign you get. A mere triplicate of gems are required to unlock the exit in each level, but there tends to be a minimum of six in the stage. Plus a roll of yarn, which can be traded with corrupt feline guards in exchange for special weapons. These are handy for dispensing with roaming enemies that lurk in certain portions of some stages, but some also have additional uses like the gun which fires a sticky pellet that can provide you with an additional, temporary platform. One of the PC version’s tweaks is the ability to carry a pair of these weapons and switch between them.If you want to get the elusive A+ grade and all of Stamper’s praise, it’s also necessary to finish each stage within a time limit. Early on, this happens practically by default, but (if you’re anything like me) you’ll quite rapidly turn into the school kid who knows he’s smart but feels like just coasting along on A’s and the occasional B rather than putting in the extra effort. If you’ve got the supple reflexes necessary for completing all of the Encore stages with an A+, then I salute you. If you can do it on Insane Mode (which removes all checkpoints, meaning any death returns you to the start of a stage) then you may very well be a witch of some kind.Your incentive for hunting down more gems is that they can be exchanged for one of BattleBlock Theater’s hundreds of prisoner heads. The heads come in all shapes and forms, so if you hoard enough gems the start of every level can be an identity crisis of your own making.BattleBlock Theater wouldn’t feel right if you weren’t able to tackle the game with a friend by your side, and The Behemoth hasn’t forgotten its Castle Crashers roots. Playing the campaign solo works perfectly fine, but BattleBlock was designed with co-op in mind, and it shows. There’s a great sense of urgency and pressure when playing co-op; not only will you have to work together in order to succeed, but collecting every gem and beating par times will require excellent teamwork.There's good fun to be had in competition, too. Up to four players can duke it out in a handful of match types, both in free-for-all or in teams. Standard modes like King of the Hill and a basic challenge mode (essentially time attack) are rounded out with more creative ones, such as ‘Horse’, which tasks you with stealing the opposing team’s horses and riding them back to your own goal. Another favourite of mine was ‘Ball Game’, which is BattleBlock’s minimalist take on basketball. The multiplayer mode is complemented by robust matchmaking options, allowing you to play both online and off, with playlist modes mixing different multiplayer modes into one, well, playlist. To cap things off, there’s a robust level editor at your disposal, which provides you with the exact same toolset that The Behemoth used. Since each level and arena was designed with the same set of block types, it’s remarkably easy to break down your favourite layouts and incorporate them into your own custom design.In essence, BattleBlock Theater is not without its frustrating moments, but such is the nature of all puzzle platformers. Any negatives noted here exist, but are slight and surely nothing more than minor blips in what is a very rewarding, very well presented, and very enjoyable and hilariously funny puzzle platformer. As the landscape of these types of games becomes increasingly bigger, it’s nice to see a game strive so hard for innovation. And in doing so can make the player feel like the cat who got the cream. Perhaps I should leave the jokes to The Behemoth experts....

												I was first hesistant to buy this game, but once it was on sale, I thought it wouldn't hurt to purchase it. In reality, I should of bought this game earlier no matter what price it was! What's even better is that you can play co-op with a friend. Trust me when I say this - I was laughing out loud as my friend and I played through each level and somehow killed each other or did something very stupid.In conclusion, this game gets my approval! After only playing about 4 hours of this game, I can say that it is well worth the money! If you are a fan of platformers and like challenges, then this is the game for you!

content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												BattleBlock theater is another amazing game by The Behemoth, the team which brought us Castle Crashers.From the very beginning, it captures the viewer with a simple, but quirky story which sets the stage (pun not intended) for the events of the game. Will Stamper brings it to life with his purposefully over-the-top silly, purposefully awkward narration style which he does better than anyone else.Gameplay is simplistic, but the levels are structured in a way which keeps you challenged by constantly providing new problems to solve. You will feel motivated to collect all of the gems and balls of yarn in a level, and try to beat the clock, before advancing to the next.BattleBlock Theater is not the first platform game of this type, but it is by far the one with the most polish. It features a good story, hilarious narration, large amounts of player customization, and creative level design.I only hope that The Behemoth decides to give their Steam release a higher priority for their next game. I was waiting in agony for both Castle Crashers, and then BattleBlock Theater!

												God where do I start with this game... A hilarious adventure through chambers of death with your best friend would probably be the best way.The narrator is one of my favorite parts lots of funny lines to keep your entertained all the way through.The platforming is process and the levels extrememly well made but you can experience a bug now and then.Multiplayer campagne is basically the singleplayer levels with a small twist here and there so im slightly disapointed but it makes up for it in the different multiplayer game modes.Its also suprisingly long for a game of this price ive been playing for over 12 hours and im still not done plus workshop will make it even longer.Finally the collectibles: SO MANY TO GET! A ton of heads, around 9 weapons and trading compatible will lead to good times.9/10 I would say buy it when you can.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												Buckle your pants extra tight for this game. This game is a big ball of fun, happiness, colors, hats, and more fun all rolled up together. You play as a person betrayed by your best friend and imprisioned by cats. The cats force you to put on these elaborate shows (The levels) for their entertainment. Out of the box its a fun simple quirky platformer. The first levels are simple, but they do good to explain the simple mechanics of the game. The single player is quite long and gets pretty hard. I recommend playing this with a friend. friends will also enjoy the insane multiplayer arena. The arena features a wide variety of amazing minigames. You can play with a few friends or random people online or if you have no friends there are bots. There is also a level editor that works with steam workshop. I have not used that in the full release but is looks quite fun. I was interestd in this game when it was just for Xbox, and quickly signed up for the PC beta when it was announced. This game is soo worth a try. There is a slice of fun for everyone.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												This is an abridged review!  The full written review can be viewed at http://coasterdude.moonfruit.com/#/video-game-reviews/4579924389/BattleBlock-Theater-Steam-Edition-Review/8472882.The Behemoth have returned with another game that will blow your pants off, so be sure to keep them buckled.  The game I'm referring to is the Steam edition of  “BattleBlock Theater,” a unique platformer filled with more than enough content.  This game takes the iconic game mechanic of “press A to jump,” and twists it into a brand new experience.  It takes place on an island of prisoners that have been imprisoned by cats where they are then forced to participate in deadly stage productions that require a lot of battling and a lot of blocks.Each level is linear, but requires you to find at least 3 gems that happen to be scattered throughout the level to unlock the exit.  There are at least 5 gems to find, and a majority of the gems are hidden inside mini-puzzles that deviate from the main path of the level.  This gives each level a much needed sense of complexity.  More importantly, the 3 gems that are required to exit the level are usually placed in spots that are almost impossible to miss.  To give the player the motivation for finding more than 3 gems, the game allows the player to use gems to purchase additional characters to play as.  However, I rarely felt compelled to find gems for the sake of a new character.  I honestly loved finding gems because of the feeling of satisfaction that I'd get from finding them in the first place.  This system of reward for exploration is astoundingly perfect.  Players that feel the need to collect as many gems as possible are well rewarded, and players that don't want to collect all of the gems are not punished.In addition, each level has 1 ball of golden yarn, and a majority of the levels contain combative cats.  The cats I'm referring to are the enemies of the game.  Their primary purpose in life seems to be to stop the player from getting to the exit via fireballs, bouncing balls, nerf guns, etc.  Although some of the cats are placed in spots where they can easily be killed by solving a minor puzzle, there are times where the player can be ambushed and must defend themself.  This game has many weapons that the player can use to attack or defend with.  Each weapon can be purchased with 5 balls of golden yarn, and each ball of golden yarn is found within the hardest mini-puzzle of each level.  Although getting 5 balls of golden yarn for just one weapon seems like too much effort, the reward is great.  The ability to kill a cat by throwing an exploding paper airplane at them is one of the greatest satisfactions to be had from this game.When playing a level, there is a chance of a golden hat randomly popping up somewhere.  If the golden hat is found and taken to the exit, the player is rewarded with 10 gems.  However, this is harder than it sounds because dying will cause the player to drop the hat.  If the hat is ever dropped in water, which is abundant, the hat is lost forever.  Not to mention that dying is very common in this game.  This game finds the perfect balance between having fun and being challenging.  Although it can be incredibly hard to get to the end of a level, The Behemoth make dying in this game an easy thing to handle.  This is thanks to the checkpoint system in the game.  There are many checkpoints placed on the way to the exit, so any progress lost due to a death is not too irritating.  However, for the maniacs out there, The Behemoth gives the player the option to play the whole game on just one life.  This option is called “Insane Mode” and is justly named.Where the game truly shines is in its co-op campaign.  Although the solo and co-op campaigns are similar, the co-op levels are more fun and more hilarious the whole way through.  Each death stops being a punishment and becomes an excuse to laugh at your friend's failure.  This laughter is usually followed by the death of the laugher's character.  Solving puzzles in the co-op campaign are infinitely more fun that solving the puzzles in the solo campaign.  There truly is something magical to be felt whenever a puzzle is solved with two minds as opposed to just one.  However, the co-op campaign has one huge problem that hinders how much fun the campaign could actually be.  Although the checkpoint system still exists in the co-op campaign, the game seems rather confused about where to respawn  characters.  These respawn areas usually end up being next to the co-op partner, at the latest checkpoint, or at the previous checkpoint.  This can end up in some puzzles being solved earlier than they should or some players spawning farther back than they should.  Either of those scenarios don't seem fair.  Thankfully, even with the respawn problem, the co-op campaign never stops being fun, even in the last 2 chapters.One of the greatest parts about the campaign mode actually has to be the plot.  That may seem like a silly thing to praise about a platformer, but the plot was surprisingly well made for this game.  Giving any of it away would be a spoiler, but how the plot is exposed is what makes it so much fun.  Each cutscene in the game is animated wonderfully and contains some of the funniest narration I have ever heard in a video game.  Each cutscene is shown at the end of a chapter, so each cutscene feels like a well-deserved reward.  The ending definitely has to be one of the most enjoyable endings I've ever seen in a video game and will definitely be creating a new fad of belt-buckling.Aside from the campaign mode, there are also many competitive multiplayer modes that can be played by up to 4 people, but most of them fell flat for me.  They can all be described as unfair and chaotic in a bad way.  For example, there's a gamemode called “Challenge” which simply let's two teams race to the end of a level.  The team that takes the least amount of times wins.  As fun as that may sound, playing that mode was severely disappointing to me.  This was mainly because the two teams do not race at the same time.  One team goes while the other watches.  This is a major problem because a majority of the time spent on a level is puzzle-solving.  In this scenario, the team going second will always have the upper hand.  However, the “Muckle” and “Ball Game” modes are rather fun to play.  “Muckle” is simply a team deathmatch mode, which is hard to screw up, and “Ball Game” is a unique take on basketball.  However, there are many multiplayer modes out there in the gaming world that these multiplayer modes simply cannot compete with.If you feel like this game needs more content, then you should know that there's even a level creator.  The level creator is a very useful tool that will give this game the longevity that it deserves.  Even if you're not the creative type, created levels can be downloaded.  Chances are that this game will give you many puzzles to solve and many platforms to jump on for a long time to come.“BattleBlock Theater: Steam Edition” is a very refreshing take on a genre that has been flooded with games.  Not only is the story worth noting, but the levels are as well.  This game is challenging, but rarely stops being fun.  The co-op campaign adds a whole knew level of hilarity and fun that most co-op campaigns miss.  The level creator  definitely gives me a reason to keep checking back on the game once in a while.  However, the competitive multiplayer modes left a bad taste in my mouth.  Overall, this is definitely a game worth jumping for joy about.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												I had always seen this on YouTube and everything else during last year (when it was released on Xbox 360), but I didn't own an Xbox, so I was a bit frustrated because I knew that The Behemoth had worked on this for a very long time, and I especially liked Castle Crashers. So, now it's been released on Steam a year later, and I completely believe that it was worth the wait. I appreciate the amount of love and effort was put into this game, and making it unlike any other game I've played (yes, it's a platformer, but it's more than that). The only thing I can criticize is the amount of players on the "Online" mode. This might just be because people are in Private Lobbies, but I'm not sure. Even if that's not the case, it has nothing to do with the quality of the game.        The storyline is fantastic (in my opinion) and it shows character (just like Castle Crasher's did, but with actual narration. Probably more so.). I enjoyed the narrator (StampyTV) throughout the entire game, and laughed a bit each time he had something to say. The multiplayer is great. Unlike their previous title (Castle Crashers), Battleblock Theater has many more gamemodes (both Co-op and competitive). All of them are fairly entertaining. I highly encourage any fans of Castle Crashers or platformers to take a look at this game, and perhaps buy it if they haven't already!

												A "story that is as warm as a mother's kiss... or is it"? After struggling for dear life in the SS Friend Ship in the middle of hurricane, you and your friends, including Hatty Hattington, are found shipwrecked in a (seemingly) abandon theater in the middle of th ocean. Now your friend Hatty is forced to manage the theaters by giant anthropomorphic cats! Worst of all, Hatty and the cats are holding you and the rest of the crew as slaves for their deadly plays! It's up to you or some to venture the theater as it plummits to chaos to save your friends and Hatty Hattington from this place that is obvioulsy heading straight to hell. Voiced by the all hilarious Will Stamper, enjoy your endovers to his amazing voice and amazing soundtrack! Also minigames. Don't forget the minigames. BUCKLE YOUR PANTS!!!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												+BattleBlock is a platformer with single player and 2 player co-op, also 4 player arena mode. The levels go easy to hard with 8 differnt chapters with 13 levels in each one of them. You collect gems and golden yarn balls that you can trade in for differnt player heads and a varitey of weapons. The voice acting in this game was fantastic, also the level designs were interesting and very challenging during the end. I spent about 20ish hours completing the game with a few breaks. There is also level deisgn which is simple enough to use. I made my first level in about 30ish minutes. I'd rate the game alone about 9/10.-The game does have alot of bugs when it comes to multiplayer. It's not very lenient with higher ping players. I myself have around 150 ping on a regular bases. When it came to pulling up players it made them spin and then fall. Collecting gems and golden yarn was also a problem it wouldn't count towards the score, I never did find out where they went. I also wish their were more customazion like maybe ramps or differnt styled blocks you could use in workshop levels. Which don't get me wrong this game is fantastic but higher ping players have a hard time enjoying multiplayer. Oh and don't forget "Buckle yo pants" for hatty!

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												You already know how good the game is on the XBLA version, but how about the port? It took the behemouth 6 years to port castle crashers over and the key bindings were not that great. I believe they've bettered themselves with porting over to the PC because I was able to bind my keys the way that I wanted, and the overlay tutorial for using said key functions for certain things, whether it be punching cats into water or sploding yourself, or purchasing an eyeball from the store.        These are the things you need to look for when purchasing Battleblok theater including the options, they are rather minimalistic as any normal 2D sidescrolling game, you got options for turning down the teture qualitly of the background, Vsync options thank goodness including multiple sound options and optimises for the narrator and audience as you play(I reccomend keeping Stampers voice tunred on for the main enjoyement of the game)      as the port stands I say it does pretty good, I was still able to enjoy the game and the combat is smooth as it ever will be.the one gripe I guess I have about it is for some reason you have to hold down two keys to climb up the ladders, one to hold on and another to move. Other than that, it's a pretty awesome game and I reccomend you go check it out.     Oh and one more thing before I go. BUCKLE YOUR PANTS!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												+BattleBlock is a platformer with single player and 2 player co-op, also 4 player arena mode. The levels go easy to hard with 8 differnt chapters with 13 levels in each one of them. You collect gems and golden yarn balls that you can trade in for differnt player heads and a varitey of weapons. The voice acting in this game was fantastic, also the level designs were interesting and very challenging during the end. I spent about 20ish hours completing the game with a few breaks. There is also level deisgn which is simple enough to use. I made my first level in about 30ish minutes. I'd rate the game alone about 9/10.-The game does have alot of bugs when it comes to multiplayer. It's not very lenient with higher ping players. I myself have around 150 ping on a regular bases. When it came to pulling up players it made them spin and then fall. Collecting gems and golden yarn was also a problem it wouldn't count towards the score, I never did find out where they went. I also wish their were more customazion like maybe ramps or differnt styled blocks you could use in workshop levels. Which don't get me wrong this game is fantastic but higher ping players have a hard time enjoying multiplayer. Oh and don't forget "Buckle yo pants" for hatty!

												In my opinion this is a fun game to Play. Its even better when you are playing with friends The game is a big puzzle were you have to save a character called hatty he is captured by furrys(idk what there called) and they put a hat on him which gives him evil powers inorder torment you with the puzzels. In order to complete a level you need to adleast get Three gems. But if you want bonus points get the rest of em inorder to gain more gems. Almost each level there is a yarn ball(there kinda secret to find but some are easy) after you complete 3 levels in a chapter it will take you outside where you have 2 options either got to the next level/chapter or you could spend your gems and yarn for heads and weapons. to get a Head it costs 10 Gems and the Weapons cost 5 Yarn balls.Also there are other gamemodes in the game to. such as VS or co-op where you can go 1v1 or 2v2 or even 2v1.The main story can also be co-op But teamwork is always requierd in this.So i hope my review has help you alot and enjoy playing :)

												This game is everything I like in coop platforming.  Here's several reasons why you should buy this game:- Unlockables galore:  You can unlock countless different avatars to play as, and the functionality behind this is very satisfying.- Low-consequence hinjinx:  Messing with your friends is going to happen when you play coop.  Dying is okay!  At least in normal mode...- The Humor:  Oh my gosh this game is hilarious.  The narration is GOLD.  If you find the comedy style of the trailer engaging, you'll enjoy the chapter-completion monologues and the in-game commentary.- The Execution:  Executing platforming maneuvers in this game is extremely satisfying, both single player and coop!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												BattleBlock theater is another amazing game by The Behemoth, the team which brought us Castle Crashers.From the very beginning, it captures the viewer with a simple, but quirky story which sets the stage (pun not intended) for the events of the game. Will Stamper brings it to life with his purposefully over-the-top silly, purposefully awkward narration style which he does better than anyone else.Gameplay is simplistic, but the levels are structured in a way which keeps you challenged by constantly providing new problems to solve. You will feel motivated to collect all of the gems and balls of yarn in a level, and try to beat the clock, before advancing to the next.BattleBlock Theater is not the first platform game of this type, but it is by far the one with the most polish. It features a good story, hilarious narration, large amounts of player customization, and creative level design.I only hope that The Behemoth decides to give their Steam release a higher priority for their next game. I was waiting in agony for both Castle Crashers, and then BattleBlock Theater!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												BattleBlock Theater is good. Like, crazy good. Coming into the game having watched a few videos on it, I'd thought it would have been a nice time to just fool around and murder your friends and whatnot. I got that, but what I had expected should have been more. I underestimated just how fun the game was.You're given tight controls, clean and art that is very good to look at. The music fits the game very well and for me, personally, much like Newgrounds music does. I've found myself rather focused on the game itself to even notice the music, and when I do, Stamper's off, meowing a few times, or something. It's humourous, it's comical, the cutscenes are done in a pesudo-puppet show fashion and pulls out plenty of fun visual gags.The level design works very well for the platforming-puzzle mechanic is has going on, and each level seemingly has those optimal designs which makes killing your friends a breeze.The weapon seem simple at first, but they can be used to bend the game or make certain aspects easier, considering you're skilled enough to use them, which can make speedrunning much more viable.If you are going to play this game, however, Grab a Friend, and preferably one who is perfectly fine with dying a few times by your hands, and willing to do the same! It keeps things fun, the air light, and you'll be smiling and laughing all the way.

Posted: June 21, 2014
												This game is VERY fun in every way. It has tons of heads (mask-like things) to collect for your characters, an easy to use level editor, and good controls (Especially with a controller)!  Not to mention the catchy music! I like the music when you go into a secret level. But you really have to try this with friends if they also own the game, because it's even MORE action-packed with butt cletching betrayal and behemoth-sized hearts of tickling, helpful kindness you can sink your nose into!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
												Okay. This game is the best co-op game I've played, ever. The trailers are what led me to the game in the first place and Stampers narration will win you over immediately with it's goofy humor. The game has lots and lots of it. So I got it, and started playing it with my friends.First thing I noticed is that the music is amazing. It's the kind of music that you search for later on youtube just to listen it on your time off from Battleblock Theatre. Then we started playing. While the campaign is co-op the game allows you to screw over your partner at every opportunity which is encouraged by quick respawns and various hilarious ways to cause your friends demise. The levels are wonderfully designed, containing exceedingly cleverer puzzles and traps and more and more different situations to fail with laughter. The controls are precise and once you get good, you can pull off stuff you wouldn't believe. If that isn't yet enough, there are arena gamemodes which all feel different and polished as well from basketball to king of the hill to capture the horse. Then there are extra levels. Then there are the levels made by other players. Then there is the level editor.This game has made me laugh more then any other coop game and I've played a lot of them. Do yourself a favor and check this game out.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												You already know how good the game is on the XBLA version, but how about the port? It took the behemouth 6 years to port castle crashers over and the key bindings were not that great. I believe they've bettered themselves with porting over to the PC because I was able to bind my keys the way that I wanted, and the overlay tutorial for using said key functions for certain things, whether it be punching cats into water or sploding yourself, or purchasing an eyeball from the store.        These are the things you need to look for when purchasing Battleblok theater including the options, they are rather minimalistic as any normal 2D sidescrolling game, you got options for turning down the teture qualitly of the background, Vsync options thank goodness including multiple sound options and optimises for the narrator and audience as you play(I reccomend keeping Stampers voice tunred on for the main enjoyement of the game)      as the port stands I say it does pretty good, I was still able to enjoy the game and the combat is smooth as it ever will be.the one gripe I guess I have about it is for some reason you have to hold down two keys to climb up the ladders, one to hold on and another to move. Other than that, it's a pretty awesome game and I reccomend you go check it out.     Oh and one more thing before I go. BUCKLE YOUR PANTS!

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												Do you like games? Do you like fun? Do you like fun games? Do you like shiny, sparkly green gems? Do you like fun games with shiny, sparkly green gems?If you answered yes to all of those questions, buy this game right now, but if you're not convinced yet, let me lay it out for you...- A great 2D action platformer that is in the golden area between easy and difficult, being approachable while also packing harder challenges.- Perfectly functional and smooth on-line and local co-operative multiplayer; the stage designs even vary based on single or multiplayer!- Amusing writing that doesn't fall back on memes or vulgar humor to do its job; you can even adjust how often jokes are made!- Great music and art design, which is to be expected considering Behemoth was previously responsible for Castle Crashers.- Shiny, sparkly green gems!
