content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												This game is totally worth the money. If you play it alone you will at least have 20-30 hours of gametime. If you try to get all the achievements you will have 50-100 hours of mixed feelings (happines, sadness, anger, pride, etc.). If you have friend that play the game you can have up to 200 hours of fun. Game mechanics are really good and it has a easy learning curve. When you pass the story you can go replay it for achievements and if you get bored with the story there are a lot of community levels. If you have a friend/s to play the game with you there is a co-op story and there are community maps aswell for co-op. There is an Arena with 8 different modes and you can play up to 4 players. If you ever get bored with the game there is a level editor that you should try out, its really easy to build levels.The only thing I was dissapointed with is that there are not a lot of players online, but that not a big deal because you can play with bots. So to end this review I would recomend this game 100%. Had a lot of fun playing it 10/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												BattleBlock Theater didn't seem that interesting at first, but when I first played it, I enjoyed it. BattleBlock Theater is a 2D game with  fun levels full of new things, and don't forget the parkour. The narrator is hilarious, and you can get a few good laughs out of him. This game also includes a level builder, so you can make whatever you wish. This game has a great story and plenty of levels, even when you beat the game there is still levels to be played made by members of the community. Also, did I mention each level has two different versions for both co-op and singleplayer? I have also enjoyed trading heads and collection them for my character. Overall, Battleblock theater is a fun, cheap, and awesome game that is only 15$ and can give you so many hours of great fun. I would recommend this game to all my friends!.

												This is a fun and hilarious game! While the controls may be a tad confusing without a gamepad (xbox 360 controller, logitech f310, etc.) they aren't too bad after a few minutes of getting used to them. If you have a weird sense of humor like myself and can be open to oddities, this game will be great for you. The only frustrating thing is that I find it VERY difficult to go through a level without dying a lot (I have done it a few times but not many), but either way the deaths don't really count against you (other than taking a hit in time trials). The whole concept of the game is strange with cat creatures holding you and your fellow creatures captive  and you earning them back by putting gems into "prisoner dispensor machines."

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												Buckle your pants extra tight for this game. This game is a big ball of fun, happiness, colors, hats, and more fun all rolled up together. You play as a person betrayed by your best friend and imprisioned by cats. The cats force you to put on these elaborate shows (The levels) for their entertainment. Out of the box its a fun simple quirky platformer. The first levels are simple, but they do good to explain the simple mechanics of the game. The single player is quite long and gets pretty hard. I recommend playing this with a friend. friends will also enjoy the insane multiplayer arena. The arena features a wide variety of amazing minigames. You can play with a few friends or random people online or if you have no friends there are bots. There is also a level editor that works with steam workshop. I have not used that in the full release but is looks quite fun. I was interestd in this game when it was just for Xbox, and quickly signed up for the PC beta when it was announced. This game is soo worth a try. There is a slice of fun for everyone.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												Ah, BattleBlock Theater, a pretty, humorous and unusual game. This, ladies and gentlemen, is a very well constructed game, that will not only make you laugh, but also give you alot of cooperative experience (if you have friends to play with ofc). The game supports multiplayer up to four players and is very stylistic in the form of bright colors. The game has its own story, and it really fits well with the style. Along with the story, you can also play Arena mode which features 8 gamemodes: Soul Snatcher, Muckle, Challange, King of the Hill, Color the World, Grab the Gold, Ball game & Capture the Horse. If you play online, it offers 3 additional gamemodes: Furbottom's Features, Community Teater & Grab Bag. There's two different ways to play Arena mode, Co-Op and VS, which is both fun. The game also has Level Editor which lets you create your very own Levels and Arena modes!In BattleBlock Theater, players control a prisoner while they are forced to play game levels, devised by Hatty Hattington, the main antegonist in the game. Controls are simple and the levels are built up with blocks, such as collapsing blocks, sticky walls, bouncy volcanic rocks and deadly spikes. The deadly spikes are... deadly, and theres more... deadly stuff such as deadly water and deadly, scary, but at the same time cute creatures!While playing, you will be introduced to the to the Gift Shop! Here you will be freeing prisoners with help of the gems you've earned. The prisoners you've saved are selectable to play as via the player setup. You can also buy weapons from the Cat Guards with Golden Yarn that you also collect while playing, some are more usefull than others, but it's all fun and games :). Wiki for the game: http://battleblocktheater.wikia.com/wiki/BattleBlock_Theater_Wiki

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Let's begin with this, would I recomend this game? Oh hell yes I would, are you kidding me. I never actually heard of BattleBlock Theater until I had a friend who told me that this game was coming out for the PC, and so I was curious about this game and decided to find out more about this game. Just watching the trailer for this game alone got me hooked on the game, but what got me even more interested about this game was the voice actor that doing all of the hilarious remarks. Since I actually knew about Stamper before I ever found out about this game I admired Stamper for his voice, cause his voice is pretty Godly, if you ask me.... I wish I could speak like that. Never the less when I had figured out that Stamper was the voice actor for this game I was absolutely thrilled about this cause it would be hours upon hours of listening to Stamper's voice constantly mocking you as die absolutely hilarious deaths. But enough about the voice acting, I'll get back to the rating of that later. To continue, the graphics on this game was in my opinion very good and very fitting for this game the layout style or genre of this game also was very fitting which does play into the story quite a bit in all honesty. So in the end I would deffinetly give this game 10/10 in graphics. Now the game mechanics I can't complain about what-so-ever, so 10/10 in game mechanics and style and so on and so forth you get the idea by now I hope. The story, oh the story. I love the story and with Stamper doing all of the voice overs you simply can't go wrong with this game's story and the humor tops it all so I would totally give this story a 10/10, which overall rating of this game would have to deffinetly be a 10/10. So back to my original question, would I recomend this game? Of course I would yet again, now in my opinion is it the best game I have ever played? Not really, but it would totally be my second favorite game that I have played (first one being FTL and third one being The Binding of Isaac). In my opinion it's just one of those games that sparks memories of me being 8 years old and playing Metroid Fussion on my Nintendo GameBoy Advance SP and constantly raging at that one dammed spider boss for some reason. But enough about my memories, just go get the game and as always, enjoy your experience.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												You already know how good the game is on the XBLA version, but how about the port? It took the behemouth 6 years to port castle crashers over and the key bindings were not that great. I believe they've bettered themselves with porting over to the PC because I was able to bind my keys the way that I wanted, and the overlay tutorial for using said key functions for certain things, whether it be punching cats into water or sploding yourself, or purchasing an eyeball from the store.        These are the things you need to look for when purchasing Battleblok theater including the options, they are rather minimalistic as any normal 2D sidescrolling game, you got options for turning down the teture qualitly of the background, Vsync options thank goodness including multiple sound options and optimises for the narrator and audience as you play(I reccomend keeping Stampers voice tunred on for the main enjoyement of the game)      as the port stands I say it does pretty good, I was still able to enjoy the game and the combat is smooth as it ever will be.the one gripe I guess I have about it is for some reason you have to hold down two keys to climb up the ladders, one to hold on and another to move. Other than that, it's a pretty awesome game and I reccomend you go check it out.     Oh and one more thing before I go. BUCKLE YOUR PANTS!

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
This is a long review so if you want a brief summary of why I recommend BattleBlock Theater then skip to Results and read from there.The Behemoth creates yet another comedy as they strive for gold in the ever ending cosmos that is the adventures of a shipwrecked crew on a terrible, no awful, wait… no terrible works, Island!!! BattleBlock Theater is a wonder game, with amusing anecdotes, rides, and all sorts of malarkey.Story:You play a member of an amazing crew of friends on you could say a friendship. As it sails across the ocean you are all having fun. Then a little storm rolls its way, the ship sways, but don’t worry nothing is wrong until suddenly out of nowhere the storm rocks a ghastly blow. Your crew is thrown everywhere, it’s very scary, trust me I saw it all. Your ship is marooned on a small little island, and the crew is held captive where else but BattleBlock Isla *cough* Theater. You leader, Hatty Hattington, is being held captive by some cats, as he sets up theatre spectacles that involve death and traps. It is your job to save him and escape from this woe, but will you succeed… well I don’t know but it will be fun to watch.Campaign:The campaign is broken up across eight chapters; each one has an outro cinematic that adds to the overall story. Each chapter consists of eleven required levels and three encores. The encores are drastically more difficult than the normal levels, and if you do not go back to a previous chapter to view the levels again you may not even know they exist. As you progress through the campaign you receive two forms of currency “Yarn” and “Gems”. You can use Gems to unlock prisoners; this essentially allows you to change your appearance. You can use Yarn to unlock weapons, each weapon costs five Yarn. Each level offers anywhere from 3-9 gems (typically 7 or 9) and 1 yarn. Be careful what you buy, as you can only get the max numbers of gems for each level one time. If you get six gems one time and then plays it again and get seven you get only onre gem. Gameplay:BattleBlock Theatre is a unique platformer that combines puzzle solving, item collection, enemies, and abilities into an incredibly in-depth game.  There are thirteen weapons you can use, each have their own purpose. In order to progress through a level you must collect at least three gems, although if you don’t collect everything and get the best time you’ll only at most get an A rather than an A++. One of the brilliant elements of this game is how each level has its own puzzles and secrets to solve. Unlock a typical platformer this game gets you to go through sections again moving blocks and manipulating enemies in order to solve complex puzzles and tasks. As you progress further through the campaign and especially on the encore levels you will notice how difficult the game can really get. Insane mode is the exact same as normal, except if you die it’s over. I would recommend normal, as insane is more likely something you’d want to do with a friend, that way if one of you dies at least the other can make it through. Steam Support:This game has workshop support, which is awesome as it allows you to download custom levels and upload your own. There are a huge variety of custom campaigns out there, which give you a whole bunch of new levels to play once you’ve beaten the original game. The community provides loads of new campaigns which is great if you are looking for a game with high replay value.Results:BattleBlock Theater is a spectacle to see, with action, and puzzles, and comedy that is just plain awesome. There are loads of levels, and depending on your play-style the campaign can take easily up to eight hours. Of course the levels in the campaign have high replay value, but to push it even further this game provides workshop content that continually updated by the players. There are loads of custom made campaigns and levels which you could try. Plus there are fun arena games where you can battle with/against friends or even random people. BattleBlock Theater has a lot of offer and if you love platformers you will want to get this game. Pros:+Combination of action, platformer, puzzle, and objective.+Great cinematics (there is a lot of comedy in this game and the cinematics between chapters were one of the big reasons I beat this game so quickly)+Loads of workshop content including custom campaigns+Keyboard/Mouse Mapping and Controller Support+A built in level-editor+Awesome multiplayer arena battles+Complete character customization (with over 300 prisoners)+Thirteen amazing weapons, not including your fists+Brilliant Soundtrack, I couldn’t help myself dancing at the end of each level. Cons:-The keyboard and mouse support seem flaky, it was as if they didn’t really try to port over a good control system.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
												This is an all around fantastic game expirience for both single and multi-player modes. I couldn't reccomend it more because of it's amazing puzzles, incredibly difficult platforming, and hillarious storyline. It'll take you about 15-20 hours to finish the story, but you'll spend many more perfecting ones you didn't get an A+ on, enjoing yourself destroying your friends and strangers in the arena, and trading hats and weapons. But before you buy, consider:-When they reccomend a controller, they mean it. Keyoard controls aren't the best.-Don't let this game come off as a Super Meatboy type expirience, the majority of the gameplay is through puzzles.-The co-op story is almost identicle to the single-player one, besides the fact that you occasionally need to help you friend get over a ledge, boost him into a hard to reach spot, ect.There's so much more to this game that makes it fantastic, I can't even squeeze it into one review. So just buy the goddam game.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
This is a long review so if you want a brief summary of why I recommend BattleBlock Theater then skip to Results and read from there.The Behemoth creates yet another comedy as they strive for gold in the ever ending cosmos that is the adventures of a shipwrecked crew on a terrible, no awful, wait… no terrible works, Island!!! BattleBlock Theater is a wonder game, with amusing anecdotes, rides, and all sorts of malarkey.Story:You play a member of an amazing crew of friends on you could say a friendship. As it sails across the ocean you are all having fun. Then a little storm rolls its way, the ship sways, but don’t worry nothing is wrong until suddenly out of nowhere the storm rocks a ghastly blow. Your crew is thrown everywhere, it’s very scary, trust me I saw it all. Your ship is marooned on a small little island, and the crew is held captive where else but BattleBlock Isla *cough* Theater. You leader, Hatty Hattington, is being held captive by some cats, as he sets up theatre spectacles that involve death and traps. It is your job to save him and escape from this woe, but will you succeed… well I don’t know but it will be fun to watch.Campaign:The campaign is broken up across eight chapters; each one has an outro cinematic that adds to the overall story. Each chapter consists of eleven required levels and three encores. The encores are drastically more difficult than the normal levels, and if you do not go back to a previous chapter to view the levels again you may not even know they exist. As you progress through the campaign you receive two forms of currency “Yarn” and “Gems”. You can use Gems to unlock prisoners; this essentially allows you to change your appearance. You can use Yarn to unlock weapons, each weapon costs five Yarn. Each level offers anywhere from 3-9 gems (typically 7 or 9) and 1 yarn. Be careful what you buy, as you can only get the max numbers of gems for each level one time. If you get six gems one time and then plays it again and get seven you get only onre gem. Gameplay:BattleBlock Theatre is a unique platformer that combines puzzle solving, item collection, enemies, and abilities into an incredibly in-depth game.  There are thirteen weapons you can use, each have their own purpose. In order to progress through a level you must collect at least three gems, although if you don’t collect everything and get the best time you’ll only at most get an A rather than an A++. One of the brilliant elements of this game is how each level has its own puzzles and secrets to solve. Unlock a typical platformer this game gets you to go through sections again moving blocks and manipulating enemies in order to solve complex puzzles and tasks. As you progress further through the campaign and especially on the encore levels you will notice how difficult the game can really get. Insane mode is the exact same as normal, except if you die it’s over. I would recommend normal, as insane is more likely something you’d want to do with a friend, that way if one of you dies at least the other can make it through. Steam Support:This game has workshop support, which is awesome as it allows you to download custom levels and upload your own. There are a huge variety of custom campaigns out there, which give you a whole bunch of new levels to play once you’ve beaten the original game. The community provides loads of new campaigns which is great if you are looking for a game with high replay value.Results:BattleBlock Theater is a spectacle to see, with action, and puzzles, and comedy that is just plain awesome. There are loads of levels, and depending on your play-style the campaign can take easily up to eight hours. Of course the levels in the campaign have high replay value, but to push it even further this game provides workshop content that continually updated by the players. There are loads of custom made campaigns and levels which you could try. Plus there are fun arena games where you can battle with/against friends or even random people. BattleBlock Theater has a lot of offer and if you love platformers you will want to get this game. Pros:+Combination of action, platformer, puzzle, and objective.+Great cinematics (there is a lot of comedy in this game and the cinematics between chapters were one of the big reasons I beat this game so quickly)+Loads of workshop content including custom campaigns+Keyboard/Mouse Mapping and Controller Support+A built in level-editor+Awesome multiplayer arena battles+Complete character customization (with over 300 prisoners)+Thirteen amazing weapons, not including your fists+Brilliant Soundtrack, I couldn’t help myself dancing at the end of each level. Cons:-The keyboard and mouse support seem flaky, it was as if they didn’t really try to port over a good control system.

												Battleblock Theater is an excellent platformer, with the beautiful design from Castle Crashers brought by the Behemoth, and a Little Big Planet playing feel. Tons of customization and the integration of the Steam Inventory for game items is awesome, and keeps the game fresh with tons of available tactics. content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												Words are not enough to describe how good this game is. I mean, there's a little guy with a square head, wearing a top hat. You can't go wrong with that. Oh yeah, CATS. Cats are everywhere. If you don't have this game, get off your couch (or chair), download this game, and then go back to your couch (or chair) and play it. Or you can sit on your couch/chair while downloading it, i mean, that works to. I have put a ton of hours into this game since I originally reviewed it, and I am still addicted. The level editor gives you all the freedom in the world, and the campaign is just amazing. Every time you have the gems to unlock a head, it is exciting going to the gift shop, and seeing what your new head will look like. There are many arena mini games, which you can play locally, or online. People are always making new level packs, so there is always something to enjoy, and neither the campaign or arena ever gets boring.  GET THIS GAME.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
Review: One of the most entertaining Co-op games I have played in a long time. The Behemoth really knows how to make a fun game with lots of characteristics like the interesting story, lots of levels, cosmetics (no DLC, just in-game currency), jokes, and everything their games have.Pros:- An amazing game to play in Co-op with a friend/your girlfriend, or against two other persons (Custom made match, or even searching an Open Public game)- The community is really kind and the players are funny and cool to play with.- You have an interesting Trade system in-game to trade your diamonds/faces for something you like/want from other players.- Each level has it's own challenge, where you can Co-op with your friend, try to kill him in a funny way, or simply try again and again until you complete it.- With near players, the lagg is almost none. Really well made for network gameplay.Cons:- I had some problems playing with 3 friends Local against 1 other friend Online. There is a restriction of 2/4 players in the same computer that might bring troubles to uneven players, but it works perfectly when inviting from Steam.Score: 10/10, a must have for all the players that love Co-op, funny challenges and annoying friends with friendly fire :P

content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
												Buckle your pants and dance.Battleblock Theater is one of those games that progressively gets harder and harder to the point that your swearing at the monitor because of how many obstacles and enemies are shooting things at you or are just getting in the way. The further you progress the more important your timing becomes, just like theater. No, seriously though, this game can get rather difficult and you'll be mashing buttons like a maniac.On the other hand, at least it's funny and the narrator keeps the stride going while telling the story as well. You're some, uh, person, on a ship with Hatty Hattington, your best friend. Suddenly, you end up shipwrecked on an island ran by cats who operate a theater. The cats, though, take you prisoner and have you "act" on their sets. The prison also has a theater section where all of the levels are "built", as you perform in front of a crowd. It's a neat take on the platforming genre. You traverse through eight chapters and a bunch of crazy stuff happens.9.3/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												I had heard of this game before, and at the time, i really didn't think much of it. when i looked at the trailer though, i immeadiately changed my mind. a game with humor like this coudn't be bad, right? RIGHT?i was right.I knew i made the right decision as soon as i started playing.now something about the game itself:The game is story-driven, but plays in separate levels accessible from a hub.The story is delivered in a funny way and has a real good flow to it. you can play in story mode in singleplayer, as well as in multiplayer. multiplayer can be played cooperatively as well as against eachother in arena mode, so there's enough choice there.the one thing i could complain about is how the levels start looking the same after a while, but that's just a minor complaint because they more than make up for it with the other elements in the game, including the level editor (did i mention there's a level editor?)All in all, a nice game with action as well as platforming fun, but it could get boring after a while for an avid gamer.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Before I say anything else about BattleBlock Theatre, I must say that it is a very JUICY adventure.The objective in this platformer is to locate and collect green gems scattered throughout each level.  Once you collect 3 of  them, the exit will open and you can complete the level.  It is a very simple concept, but it can be very addicting and delicious.  Only 3 gems are required to finish each level but if you are a big time sumo wrestling grand champion and you want to devour everything, then you will be rewarded with an A++ on a level if you manage to find all of the gems and the secret Yarn in each stage.  Completionists are rewarded for their MLG skills.For godlike players looking for an even greater challenge, there is INSANE mode that sends you back to the beginning of the stage every time you die.  Even though every slam is fatal in this mode, I found it very fun due to the challenge and because you can get even more gems in this mode. While I enjoyed this game greatly, I feel that some may get bored of it quickly.  If you don't enjoy the simple platforming/puzzling that it offers then you won't have any reason to keep playing.  It will keep on throwing more levels at you while ramping up the diffculty until the end.  A comparison would be some fat lard who keeps on eating macaroni noodles even though he doesn't like them. Don't be that fat kid!  I suggest looking at some gameplay before you buy.One great feature in this game, however, is the Co-op play.  If the single player portion of the game doesn't hold your interest, then playing alongside your tag team sumo wrestling partner might be the key to success.  Story mode supports 2 players at once in Co-op play, and in Arena mode you can play with up to 4 players.  The best parts of these modes are laying a smackdown on your friends.  You can uppercut them, you can push them into a lake, you can explode on top of them, you can throw grenades at them, and you can use FROG EXPLOSIVES against them.  Much hilariousness to be had.There is also an announcer in BattleBlock who comments on your journey with many funny insults and tips.  He may call you a spicy little fart or something. The announcer, along with the amusing deaths that you and your friends will endure, provides this game with plenty of "Haha Laughter".At the end of the day, this is one of the best platformers on steam. Very simple, very humorous, and even better with friends. Go and check it out today you blubbery sea slugs.BattleBlock Theatre has been given the score of "Chanko Stew Out of 10".  Thank you for tuning in.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												This game. This game may not have really won every game of the year award ever, but by gum it deserves it! Where to start?William Stamper.I have always been a fan of Stamper's humour and when I heard he had done the naration on a game I was blown away. But that's not the reason why I had to throw all my money at it.Gameplay.The controls were responsive and easy to learn, for a title that was ported from xbox, my logitech controller has yet to misfire (hem hem, Darksiders COUGH!) Customizability (do you even into the english language?).From changing my colour to the shape of my head, I was able to make the perfect prisoner, but I find myself changing my head daily JUST BECAUSE I CAN!Story.I was in tears, THE PLIGHT OF HATTY IS STILL FRESH IN MY HEART AND MIND!MultiplayerIf, like me, you're tired of the moaning "MLG PROS" on tf2 mix servers, then my son it's time for a change. If you enjoyed super smash bros, feel free to try at the game mode of the same name (don't you quote on me that) I had a righteous giggle, molesting two other players because my team mate "lost connection"Verdict11/10 would play again, if only to hear Stamper cry "NO! DONT DIE! It's a real gem from the indie scene and well worth the $15 price tag ($3.74 if you act now)

Posted: December 30, 2014
												This has easily become one of the best indie platformers I have ever played!Remember in Super Mario Brothers 3 where it looked like it was a performance? Well this game takes that setting and expands it like crazy, you can create your own levels for your friends to play on!Also the soundtrack is awesome, and my favourite has to go to the secret levels, honestly the music is up there with Awesomenauts, Payday 2 and Teamfortress 2 as being some of the best on Steam.The charm of this game is through the roof and the voice acting by two rather famous youtube celebrities do a fantastic job, also the humour easily makes it the funniest game I have played in ages.Just like Tiny and Big, I feel bad getting this at £1.09 in the winter sale, the developers deserve every penny because this game is amazing.If you love platformers, theres no reason to say no to this great game.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
												Buckle your pants and dance.Battleblock Theater is one of those games that progressively gets harder and harder to the point that your swearing at the monitor because of how many obstacles and enemies are shooting things at you or are just getting in the way. The further you progress the more important your timing becomes, just like theater. No, seriously though, this game can get rather difficult and you'll be mashing buttons like a maniac.On the other hand, at least it's funny and the narrator keeps the stride going while telling the story as well. You're some, uh, person, on a ship with Hatty Hattington, your best friend. Suddenly, you end up shipwrecked on an island ran by cats who operate a theater. The cats, though, take you prisoner and have you "act" on their sets. The prison also has a theater section where all of the levels are "built", as you perform in front of a crowd. It's a neat take on the platforming genre. You traverse through eight chapters and a bunch of crazy stuff happens.9.3/10

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												I can't speak highly enough about this game.  I LOVE it.  As you can see, I've logged over 150 hours and I'm still not done.  Yes, I've beaten the single player mode on normal and insane with A++ on every level.  I've played a lot of co-op with several different people.  I've enjoyed some of the arena modes and had a blast hosting a game night for it in my old gaming clan.  I'm still playing weekly to collect star heads.  So why do I keep coming back?   The art style is wonderful.  The overall humor  is great and, in my opinion, this game has the best narrator of any game.  The platforming controls are tight and as you play the game more and more, you gain a better and better sense of control.  This means that although the insane mode seemed like madness when I first started playing, by the time I was ready to tackle it, it felt doable.  There's a large variety of collectable heads that you can constantly swap in order to feel like you're playing a new character.  I've heard the main story many times now and it just doesn't get old.  Also, the end song is immensely satisfying.  Whether you'll be playing alone or with friends or both, this game has hours of fun in store for you.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
FOR BATTLEBLOCK THEATERBattleblock Theater is an amazing game developed by amazing developers. It is challenging for hardcore players (via insane mode and some of Furbottom's Features) while also being a good casual couch game for friends and family. The co-op meets even at the level of Portal 2, (but does NOT exceed it, Portal 2 is the best) and the narrator, Will Stamper, is absolutely hilarious. I had quite a few laughs during the cinematics. All in all, Battleblock Theater is one of the best out there. I suggest it for anyone and everyone. If you do enjoy it, check out Castle Crashers, a 2D side scroller indie made by the same developer, The Behemoth.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
This is a long review so if you want a brief summary of why I recommend BattleBlock Theater then skip to Results and read from there.The Behemoth creates yet another comedy as they strive for gold in the ever ending cosmos that is the adventures of a shipwrecked crew on a terrible, no awful, wait… no terrible works, Island!!! BattleBlock Theater is a wonder game, with amusing anecdotes, rides, and all sorts of malarkey.Story:You play a member of an amazing crew of friends on you could say a friendship. As it sails across the ocean you are all having fun. Then a little storm rolls its way, the ship sways, but don’t worry nothing is wrong until suddenly out of nowhere the storm rocks a ghastly blow. Your crew is thrown everywhere, it’s very scary, trust me I saw it all. Your ship is marooned on a small little island, and the crew is held captive where else but BattleBlock Isla *cough* Theater. You leader, Hatty Hattington, is being held captive by some cats, as he sets up theatre spectacles that involve death and traps. It is your job to save him and escape from this woe, but will you succeed… well I don’t know but it will be fun to watch.Campaign:The campaign is broken up across eight chapters; each one has an outro cinematic that adds to the overall story. Each chapter consists of eleven required levels and three encores. The encores are drastically more difficult than the normal levels, and if you do not go back to a previous chapter to view the levels again you may not even know they exist. As you progress through the campaign you receive two forms of currency “Yarn” and “Gems”. You can use Gems to unlock prisoners; this essentially allows you to change your appearance. You can use Yarn to unlock weapons, each weapon costs five Yarn. Each level offers anywhere from 3-9 gems (typically 7 or 9) and 1 yarn. Be careful what you buy, as you can only get the max numbers of gems for each level one time. If you get six gems one time and then plays it again and get seven you get only onre gem. Gameplay:BattleBlock Theatre is a unique platformer that combines puzzle solving, item collection, enemies, and abilities into an incredibly in-depth game.  There are thirteen weapons you can use, each have their own purpose. In order to progress through a level you must collect at least three gems, although if you don’t collect everything and get the best time you’ll only at most get an A rather than an A++. One of the brilliant elements of this game is how each level has its own puzzles and secrets to solve. Unlock a typical platformer this game gets you to go through sections again moving blocks and manipulating enemies in order to solve complex puzzles and tasks. As you progress further through the campaign and especially on the encore levels you will notice how difficult the game can really get. Insane mode is the exact same as normal, except if you die it’s over. I would recommend normal, as insane is more likely something you’d want to do with a friend, that way if one of you dies at least the other can make it through. Steam Support:This game has workshop support, which is awesome as it allows you to download custom levels and upload your own. There are a huge variety of custom campaigns out there, which give you a whole bunch of new levels to play once you’ve beaten the original game. The community provides loads of new campaigns which is great if you are looking for a game with high replay value.Results:BattleBlock Theater is a spectacle to see, with action, and puzzles, and comedy that is just plain awesome. There are loads of levels, and depending on your play-style the campaign can take easily up to eight hours. Of course the levels in the campaign have high replay value, but to push it even further this game provides workshop content that continually updated by the players. There are loads of custom made campaigns and levels which you could try. Plus there are fun arena games where you can battle with/against friends or even random people. BattleBlock Theater has a lot of offer and if you love platformers you will want to get this game. Pros:+Combination of action, platformer, puzzle, and objective.+Great cinematics (there is a lot of comedy in this game and the cinematics between chapters were one of the big reasons I beat this game so quickly)+Loads of workshop content including custom campaigns+Keyboard/Mouse Mapping and Controller Support+A built in level-editor+Awesome multiplayer arena battles+Complete character customization (with over 300 prisoners)+Thirteen amazing weapons, not including your fists+Brilliant Soundtrack, I couldn’t help myself dancing at the end of each level. Cons:-The keyboard and mouse support seem flaky, it was as if they didn’t really try to port over a good control system.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												I can't speak highly enough about this game.  I LOVE it.  As you can see, I've logged over 150 hours and I'm still not done.  Yes, I've beaten the single player mode on normal and insane with A++ on every level.  I've played a lot of co-op with several different people.  I've enjoyed some of the arena modes and had a blast hosting a game night for it in my old gaming clan.  I'm still playing weekly to collect star heads.  So why do I keep coming back?   The art style is wonderful.  The overall humor  is great and, in my opinion, this game has the best narrator of any game.  The platforming controls are tight and as you play the game more and more, you gain a better and better sense of control.  This means that although the insane mode seemed like madness when I first started playing, by the time I was ready to tackle it, it felt doable.  There's a large variety of collectable heads that you can constantly swap in order to feel like you're playing a new character.  I've heard the main story many times now and it just doesn't get old.  Also, the end song is immensely satisfying.  Whether you'll be playing alone or with friends or both, this game has hours of fun in store for you.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
FOR BATTLEBLOCK THEATERBattleblock Theater is an amazing game developed by amazing developers. It is challenging for hardcore players (via insane mode and some of Furbottom's Features) while also being a good casual couch game for friends and family. The co-op meets even at the level of Portal 2, (but does NOT exceed it, Portal 2 is the best) and the narrator, Will Stamper, is absolutely hilarious. I had quite a few laughs during the cinematics. All in all, Battleblock Theater is one of the best out there. I suggest it for anyone and everyone. If you do enjoy it, check out Castle Crashers, a 2D side scroller indie made by the same developer, The Behemoth.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
												Very friendly and extremely enjoyable platform game.Literally theater, because everything is happening in front of audience in theater. And they are all cats.Single Player story is introduced through simple story-cutscenes after every chapter, using narrator. This narrator will often speak during the game, usually saying something hilarious... Whole game is constructed to be funny. The point of every level is to grab as many diamonds, as you can and get to the exit. In your way will be deadly spikes, hostile cats and... more random obstacles. Story also allows co-op mode. Even though most level are in coop slightly modified, it brings very different experience. Everything is more fun with friends, right?Besides story mode, there is arena, that contains many PvP modes like King of the Hill, Capture the Horse and more - not just made by developers, but also player-made. There are also player-made adventure playlists. Multiplayer can be played locally or online, which is currently weaker, but you can usually find some games.Story mode and official arena maps will earn you diamonds and yarns, which you can use to buy new head skins and weapons. These can be later traded with real players, directly ingame.Game also has its ingame level editor, where you can make your own maps of any type - adventure playlist or arena.+ Local Co-op+ Narrator+ Level Editor- Weak (but alive) online MultiplayerThis game brought many laugh-hard moments and its always well wasted time. :D9/10

content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												A quirky platformer  that borrowed most of the good features from Super Meat Boy & Spelunky, but then the game is also dripping is delicious absurdist humour. The result is that it feels like you are playing a party game which is wonderful when playing punishing platformer puzzles.The Positives- As a platformer the puzzles are excellent and there are many levels/stages- big variety of new and old platformer gameplay mechanics; eg. enemies that chase you and bump you around- a story in a platformer, yes I know 'who cares', but it is a delightful non-sequitur intermission to the rest of the game.- whimsical humour - from the story narration to commentary on your deaths & level completion- 4 player co-op online or 2 player local- great soundtrack & Voice Acting- Cartoon-y art style is pleasingI didn't feel that a gamepad was necessary, so that means if you do have a gamepad then 2 player local co-op will be easy. The only real problem I/you have is that the game strongly prefers to be online. You can't get all the bonus gear if you are not online (largely cosmetic items which you trade for with in game collectable gems).Steam Cloud Sync is buggy and you may all lose progress switching between online and offline. If you discover you have to start over again (i.e. saves wiped), immediately kill the game so it doesn't autosave - then resync online. Got me twice, sigh.Conclusion:A very good spin on the platformer genre - highly recommended if you want a platformer or a 2 player "couch co-op" game.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												A deeply emotional game where you play as a schizophrenic man on the set of a snuff film. While you see the world as a cartoony and happy landscape, it's actually quite far from that. You're forced to collect the severed heads of your friends which have been painted green, the protagonist portrays them as gems, symbolizing objects of great value. This makes sense, since the protagonist is forced to put on a show for the viewers, i.e dodging traps, falling close to death, almost drowning, and collecting the heads of his friends, or he is killed.The game also has some enemies, and the whole show is run by cats. Cats are seen by humans, instinctively, as predators. This is what they are, as you know how dangerous lions and tigers are, and you feel fear around them. This is why he views them as cats. He knows they can end his world, and he has to avoid them or even fight back in some cases.A bit dark for a platformer, but it spices things up.edit: Some people actually thought this was serious?

content:
Posted: November 12, 2014
												BattleBlock Theater is a great game. The narration is funny, the co-op is great with friends and the level editor has a really well-thought-out system for controller use. Controllers are recommended for the best experience. The customisation in the game is somewhat extensive as you can unlock different "prisoners" (just different heads your character can use) and weapons from the gift shop in game. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs a game to just sit back and laugh at. Screw Steam sales, just buy it. Now.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
BATTLEBLOCK THEATERREVIEWBattleblock Theater is kinda the "LittleBigPlanet" for PC. A 2D game, combining humor, fun, and amazing level designs and challenges with a cool story, Battleblock is a cool game, for a cool price, that every PC Gamer should have. With a 10+ hour story, a lot of extras and secrets to find to get A++ rating in a levels, it's a game with a lot of things to do. if you are planning to do all those things, prepare to play for 30+ hours. Battleblock have cool cartoon graphics, easy gameplay, a lot of cool weapons, and hundreds of heads for customization! The game also have a cool online mode and a complete co-op campaign play with your friends! Batteblock theater is a cool game to play for fun and/or with friends. But do not play it for much time no-stopping. It can become boring! But it's a fun game when you have nothing to do or wanna have some fun. If you like this game, another cool one for the same developer, but action-packed is Castle Crashers!+Cool cartoon graphics+Funny story+Fun and easy gameplay+AMAZING ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK!+Narrator voice-acting!+Best ending ever in a video-game+Cool level designs+A lot of things to do+Many weapons and customization-Can become boring if you play too much no-stopping-Few BugsBatteblock Theater is an amazing indie experience with a lot of fun 9/10

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												First of all: If you click+hold "Ctrl" key you will fart and explode. BattleBlock Theater's is a mix of CastleCrashers + SuperMeatBoy + OneyNG voicelike crazy narration + weird... cats. This platform game is awesome both on single-player or multiplayer (co-op). This game is quite difficult (especially in time-attack stages), having many sort of traps. The story is a true definition of insanity, athought the story was made to be like that, which makes this game unique. You can widely costumize your character in terms of face, color and weapons.  Also, this game has its own Steam Inventory with your Battleblock Theater items, these items can be tradable and/or marketable. In all, this game is pretty funny and creative.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2014
												This game is, to put it simple: Hilarious.The story is told by Stamper, if anyone knows him, a guy with a great narrator voice as shown in the game. During the game he will pretty much tell you what is going on and what you shouldn't do: Dieing mostly.In cutscenes he will progress the story and tell you all kinds of things in a fun fashion.The gameplay is nothing that spectaculair but still really good. It's a puzzle platformer as much as it can be a platformer. In 2D, you will run, jump, ride and slide across blocks of various elements, collecting gems to open the exit. The difficulty progression is steady and with the amount of levels, the final ones will/can be really frustrating but certainly do-able.The music is happy and upbeat as the game itself and with the great visual style, jokes and voice-acting, I believe this is certainly a game looking into.Additionally, it has multiplayer, so you can even go nuts with your friends in existing or self-made levels!

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												I first played this game on the Xbox 360 when it was free with Gold. I loved it. I beat the whole game and bought all the heads. But when I found out it was on Steam, I instantly bought it. I only have 5.9 hours, but I played the Xbox version so much I think I have a very clear verdict:This game is amazing!!! Incredibly fun, hilarious and charismatic. The game itself shouldn't take longer than 2-3 weeks to complete, but there's still much more to do. Co-Op, multiplayer VS matches, building your own stages to ruin friendships. I won't say much about the story, other than it's completely nonsensical and bizarre.To get the most out of BBT, I recommend an Xbox 360 controller for maximum enjoyment. If you've thought getting the game, DO!!! But be warned.......the story has 8 different chapters, and they get increasingly difficult. 6 and 7 especially so. 8 not so much, but that's probably because you're used to the game at this point. But if you're still not satisfied......You give a cat some yarn and he gives you an exploding frog.SCORE OUT OF 10: 9.0/10

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												// BattleBlock Theater 2D Platform Adventure Game : //// Schuitje82 - Extended Review //About the Game:============After playing Castles Crasher as a crazy person on many platforms it was a big surprise to see they did not make a part two of this videogame.No, they made a totally new game that having nothing to do with castle crashers in any way.So me playing this game was a little bit sceptical about this game because I love the Castle Crasher franchise so much.First when you start the game you will be pulled in with the crazy story they tell you about Hatty going on adventure and laugh if you like english humor and the way they tell you this.After some days on sea you crash your boot on a island in the middle of nowhere we cats are the bosses and will take you and harry prisoners.Gameplay:========The core gameplay is as basic as it can be if you ask me.You collect the gems of tree that will set you free of every stage only there are more items to collect because of every stage haves more than 3 gems and a ball of wool to collect.The gems can be used to unlock new character parts and the wool can be used to get new weapons. The game haves a super massive collection of body part to unlock so you will need al the gems you can find if you want to unlock them all. What makes it fun to collect because the game generate sometime the item the Golden Head and will grand you exra of 10 gems and the end if you can finish the stage with the item.And what makes this game extra cool is that you can play alone and with a friend in full story mode co-op offline or online and this is a lot of fun because you will NEED to work together.Otherwise can not complete the stages because you need the partner to help you.There is an support for 4 player offline / online main problem this is that you only can play mini games fun still co-op 4-player would be much better and much more fun.The game supports many challenges for many and many hours and if you are done with these you can even make your own if you like totally massive download stages so you can not be bored with this video game.Controls:=======For the casual player this will need some practice because of some crazy jumps over time you need to take if you want to reach the last gem of need to jump over spikes.Beside that it’s an easy to learn videogame and will give you no frustration if you look to the controls.I try’s the game with an Xbox 360 controller and everything works perfectly even the button layout has been supported by this game.Overall:======If you like me are a big fan of the The Behemoth Studios games you will love this game to.It is not an Beat ’em Up like the Castle Crasher series still it’s a freaking good and fun game for young and old.Score - 9/10.== For more reviews go to www.gamegrin.com ==== Please don't forget to like my reviews ==

Posted: June 24, 2014
												First glance, it seems like a basic platformer will little to offer. Surprisingly, there's so much more to it. From customizing how your character looks to creating levels yourself, there's surprising depth to this 2D game.Another surprise is that the multiplayer campaign has the same basic layout as single player campaign. And yet, they MAKE you cooperate with whoever you're playing with, making collectibles a team effort. Much to love in The Behemoth's BattleBlock Theater.

												Fantastic

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												(The following review is loosely based on a real history)Well... How can I begin? This game is awesome! Got me in love right at the hillarious intro sequence. The whole game is quite fun to play and it has local and online co-op! Double the humor, double the action, double the ache in your cheeks and diaphragm after you f*** up with your friend's jump and make him/her fall in some spikes!This is that type of game where you turn to your best bro and says "Hey, dude, give me a little hand here" and then s/he punches you in the face and you fall to your death and s/he starts crying, but not because s/he's sad, but because s/he's an a**hole and can't stop laughing at you, and you're all like "Well, not THAT kind of hand", but also laughs because you're an idiot that didn't stop to think of what you were about to say.If you like platformer, humor and screwing up with your mates, then buy this game, because I'm saying so. You can trust me! Who doesn't trust a guy who always find a way to kill his best friend?The gameplay:Well, it's a platformer and you jump and kill some fat security cats (and your friends!), and collect some faces and have some weapons that are cool like a hadouken-ish fireball that'll burn your enemies (and friends!), but also have some that are really worthless, like a little rubber ball or whatever was that little piece of round ****. The co-op features some actions like throwing your friend (to his/her death, if you wish so... And you know you'll wish so, don't try to be that "I never kill my friend" guy now) or using him/her as a ladder to reach higher platforms (and then coming back to help him/her, because you'll need his/her help to proceed, but only after taking all the gems you could without his/her help).There's also an Arena Mode with different types of games that you can play online with some random guys or with your friends. I think it's up to 4 players, at least it was the maximum I managed to play with.And there's an editing mode, like said in the trailer, where you can create your own level and share with people over the internet so they can have more fun and spend more time playing this game while the developers sit back and throw away any worry of updating the game with new stuff!Oh yeah! You can also trade your items through the steam inventory or directly in-game, like Pokémon.The story:During a very peaceful journey aboard a little boat with your trusty friends, you find an island where they capture and force your friends to perform at a sadistic and horrendous shows at the local theater. And now you're the only one who can save them all!... Except that you get captured too and are forced to perform on those shows. Now! It's up to you to perform well and get out of there alive with your friends! What are you waiting for? Go call a friend and perhaps s/he can be your sidekick! Who doesn't want to be a superhero (with a sidekick!) with their own comic published in the entire world in different languages? Ok, you don't get to have comics published in different languages, or in the entire world... you don't become a superhero at all, ok? But you can still have a trusty sidekick! Ok, perhaps not so trusty, but you can still have a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ sidekick that will ruin your journey and make your quest harder! Well, stopping to think of it, you would like to kill your sidekick before he kills you... hm...Note: 12/10

												There are many reasons as to why you should be playing this game, and if I were to list them all, you'd be old and grey when I finished.Firstly, there's hilarity to be had as you swim, crawl, duck, punch, fly, float...err...walk...your way around each stage!Secondly, there's all these gloRIOUS BODY PARTS YOU CAN OBTAIN when you free prisoners! CUSTOMISAYSHUN!Thirdly-LOOK, THEY'RE CATS. WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED TO KNOW?!Fourthly...seriously, how can you NOT appreciate being licked by a maniacle, loathsome, cute and cuddly hairball of death and destruction?Eightly, there's some kind of level editor. I don't know about you, person, but I love creating impossible challenges for all my friends to hate me more with!Thirty-Ninethly, uhm...I lost track, sorry3497394thlythaT'S RIGHT I REMEMBER NOW, there's like a BILLLION different things to collect! number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
												I LOVE THIS GAME!!!For me: Best narrator ever! Stamper did a really an amazing job here <3 Just listen to the "Steam Announcment Trailer" above and you'll hear the beautiful comedy-narration in this beautiful game.I also really enjoyed the music in every stage, very well done!The gameplay is a simple platformer but gets really difficult as you progress through the levels, especially when you collect everything in every stage or even play on Insane mode. It could be a little frustrating sometimes but you will get back and "do this without dying or messing up".And if you have a friend to rely on, you can also play coop where the stages are missing some blocks to jump on, so you'll have to use teamactions to get each other to the exit... or you betray the sh*t out of them! >:DIt also has (online) multiplayer matches with some funny gamesmodes.Overall a really good game, can't wait for Behemoth's next game :D

content:

												There are a whole slew of good single-player, controller-supported platformers on Steam, and this is certainly among the best. The real strength of this game, however, is it in 2-player local co-op campaign, where the hilarity of certain death and comic nature of the story and gameplay make for a fantastic shared experience between two friends.My girlfriend, who is not a gamer, absolutely loved this game when I made her play through it, and I'm certain she would recommend it to any couple looking to kill some time on a rainy Sunday, when Netflix isn't quite filling the void like it's meant to.

												Let me just say, this game is hilarious. If you want a comedy game, this one's for you. Not only are the puzzles actually hard (and they get harder as you progress), they are rewarding. You can get gems to buy hats for your characters, or collect yarn for new powers (if you don't want to spend cash in the Steam market. This game is very fun with friends, with many things to do. The steam workshop also makes this version better than the XBLA version. The level editor has every block you will see in the game, and the enemies too, for you to play with. There are many versus modes and things to do in this game. I highly think people should buy this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Definitely the best platformer I've ever played. Use the entire world around you to complete levels and earn gems and yarn - jumping on walls, exploding blocks, boats, and even your own dead bodies and weapons, just to name a few. There are so many different ways to solve each level and a set of weapons you can use to do it, even if you're alone. Dart guns, exploding frogs, acidic bubbles, and fireballs all help you to get by - Not to mention the awesome music, arena mode, and level editor. 10/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2016
												The whole point of BattleBlock Theater is to be absurd and hilarious, and it does it very well. It's a great party game, but the single-player campaign is equally entertaining.From the first cutscene in the campaign, you'll be laughing your head off. After every set of levels, another cutscene will bring to light the unfortunate story of the island you're trapped on and the cat overlords that inhabit it. The cutscenes are filled with absurd gags. Sometimes the humor is very childish and immature, but handled in a way so that they're funnier for being childish than for the actual joke itself. All the while, the story gets more absurd with each cutscene.Then, level by level, you'll be slowly making your way through a gauntlet of deadly platforming challenges to amuse your cat captors. After every death, the announcer will make light of your unfortunate demise. The levels are well-designed and challenging, and are only frustrating in a couple tricky spots. On rare occasion you will find "secret" rooms, where the announcer sings an absurd song constantly. Luckily it only takes a minute or to get everything in a secret room (even if you take your time), so you're out before it gets annoying.The multiplayer is very well-designed. There is couch co-op if you manage to get a few Xbox controllers, and maybe have one unfortunate player use the keyboard, but there's also online multiplayer. The lag can be noticeable at times, but is less of an issue for a party game. There are a variety of multiplayer modes, but I've found Muckle (team deathmatch) to be the most fun. The game is a few years old though, so finding an online game without coordinating with friends can be difficult. As for co-op, every level is redesigned to require cooperation with your partner. Ironically, the game gives you plenty of opportunities to sabotage them, even encouraging you sometimes. Good luck trusting your friends.This game is not a serious platformer, and doesn't try to be. It's a unique, entertaining experience that will stick in your mind for years.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2015
												Narrator- “Get the best time and I’ll give you a kiss because I love you!” This is one of the funniest games that you will ever play. And here's why; the narrator is absolutely out of his mind, he says all sorts of funny stuff especially  in the cutscenes . The plot consists of cats who have taken your friends prisoner after your boat  the "SS Friendship" is shipwrecked on a island .Aside from the hilarious lines and the evil evil kitties, this game is a surprisingly fun platformer that will keep you entertained until the very end. The levels aren't long, but can get extremely frustrating from time to time, especially if you're trying to collect every gem. And even though there aren't any "bosses" in the game, the last level of every floor is timed, and can be pretty difficult to get through. All-in-all, if you're looking for a new platformer to sink your teeth in to, consider picking this game up as it's one of the best platformers on Steam ,...... ohhh wait !!! There is also Multiplayer where you can team up with a buddy and you can play the levels using teamwork and stuff or kill your friends and countless other players in the Arena mode. And if you don't, then you'd better watch your back, because the cats are surely coming for you. Oh yeah, and did I mention that the soundtrack is totally awesome? Because it is. And anyone who knows their platformers knows how incredibly important a killer soundtrack can be. What are you still doing here ? Buy the game !!!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												As of writing this, I've owned this game for less than a day and there have already been at least 6 times where I had to pause the game and put down my controller because I was laughing so hard.  I don't think a video game ever made me laugh this much.  The narrator is hilarious.The gameplay kind of reminds me of Little Big Planet since they're both platformers with level editors that allow you to share your custom made levels with the community, but this game has better controls and a much more user-friendly interface. Character customization isn't quite as diverse as LBP since you're limited to just interchangeable heads and basic colors, but there's lots of heads to unlock and you can trade them with friends.I'm also really glad that this game has local multiplayer.  There aren't nearly enough PC games out there with multiplayer that can be played on one PC.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I believe the ending to battleblock theater to be a high point of the post modern era for it's abiltiy to both portray the likeness of the casual gamers current situation they find them self in. Buckle up your pants, it's such a simple phrase but when you really consider it, pants is of course a metaphor to you, the gamer who's philosphical fly is open to new ideas an experiences but you have no direction and let everything out opening yourself up to harm and emotional distress. This game enthuses the idea to buckle up and tell the casual gamer to be more conceded and not to trust to easily. This is easily a defining problem in this era of gaming of people getting to connected to these digital presences of, essentially real life people, that they can relate to, and the thing keeping there fly down, which is of course resembled with hatty. When in the end after all of your trials and anguish it is simply that hatty must be put down and you must buckle of up your fly so you are not quick to connect to characters and are still capable of human interaction. It is telling the gamer to go out and live life and not be tied down to fake relationships. Simply a beautiful game. 4/10

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												This game is really solidly built and really fun, but damn if it doesn't slap you in the balls a couple of times. The art style is simple and nice to look at, the story is fantastic (it's basically a rescue the princess story with a Behemoth twist), and the music is... music to the ears! I really don't recommend the online multiplayer, because 9 times out of 10, your partner and/or you is going to have serious lag issues. Also, the AI of the bots in singleplayer versus is just... Eghhhhh... I think they have the same AI as the cats in the regular game, just slightly harder. They always have discs, no variation between their weapons. Sometimes, since they have perfect knowledge of what to do because they're soulless programs, they will pin you into a corner until you can actually god damn move. But either way, Battleblock Theater is a charming experience that you should definitely jump in to.I give this game 8 cats out of 10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Meow meow? Meow meow meow.... MEOOOWW!!! MEOW MEOW~~~ That's it. :3Jokes aside, amazing and brilliant platformer I've played in a while since I last played Nintendo platformers (Mario, Kirby, DKC)So far I've played Co-Op Campaign with my friend, but haven't played Arena that much, so I'll be focusing on the Main Mode review : Levels : Very creative and well-thought. Love to see large variety of blocks, enemies, and puzzles. Though at some times need several attempts to pass through a section (Using wings to fly through a room full of obstacle and hazards) and/or to get gems and yarns. Enemies are surprisingly CATS SPEWING HAZARDS, block-shaped reindeer that will eat you upon sight (or whatever that is), Robots with their homing rockets, and more. Also I like how the Co-Op Campaign is surprisingly designed for 2 players, while solo is designed so it's possible for 1 player. There's also Encore levels which, after clearing the Finale (last level of a chapter), are unlocked. They are time-based levels (like the Finale) where you must clear in an amount of time and the time can be replenished with checkpoints. Recommended for those who seek time-based challenges.Gameplay : Really satisfying, the movements are very solid, and Co-Op movement features that made the game also enjoyable (You can smack and push your partner to hazards, too! or kill em with your weapons!) There are also mounts, block-shaped horses (I didn't realize that was a horse at first). At some points, using weapons can be a bit of annoyance though, as it could end up killing you too. And I noticed several bugs and glitches.Other than that, the movements, climbing, and Co-Op movements (Judo throwing your partner across wide blocks of water, or lending a hand to help your partner jump onto a high cliff), making the game satisfyingly enjoyable.There's Normal and Insane Mode. Normal is for casual playing as it gives endless of lives, so the goal is just collect the gems and yarns and get to the exit.Tried Insane a few levels solo, and it gives more yet challenging levels for those who want more from this game. Insane gives you only 1 Life (Shared on Co-Op) and it will restart from the beginning of the level if you hit any hazards once.Gift Shop : I checked and did a research, there are about 320-ish characters ready to be unlocked, and many weapons. I liked how each weapon has their own distinctive use, Flying Disc is thrown and acts as a time bomb. Dart sticks onto a solid block and gives you a platform to stand. Frog walks over the level and explodes when someone is near.Character unlockables are traded with gems, and it's satisfying to see them came out after clearing a few levels.Music & Story : Oh damn I'm in love with the music! Gives you the feeling of Opera-ish theme. The music always keep you at your seat at all times. The story gives lots of humor, while keeping the plot solid and interesting. :3. (Oh, there's a truckload of cats!!)What I like to see : 4-Player Co-Op Campaign for future Platformers (if Behemoth plans to make another). 2-Player is good and enjoyable enough, but I would like to see a 4-player Platformer such like Kirby's Return to Dreamland (Wii), although there's also 4-Player Arena which is also quite enjoyable.Conclusion : Buy it and invite your friends! Very recommended for all true platformer fans, and support this amazing dev! :)

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												MY RATING: 10/10Ah, the Behemoth has done it again with this instant classic for a game, Battleblock Theater. When this game first came out on Steam, I immediately bought it, because I already knew how the gameplay was; absolutely amazing. The whole story plot and levels were very well thought out and amazing. This idea of a game was a miracle to all of the gaming community. Everything is really cheap too. Buying the game for 15 bucks, worth it. Heads, they're free and also able to be bought for only a few cents in the community market.FACTS ABOUT BATTLEBLOCK THEATER:Cat Enemies - Because, why not?The Narrator - My god such a beautiful voice.Free-To-Win - All you need to do is buy the game.The Story Plot - The plot of the story is the best part. It's absolutely FLAWLESS.Graphics - Beautifully made graphics.Funny Game - It's a really comedic game, which makes for a fun time!Progressing -  When you progress into the game it gets harder, which is what we all love.Game Design -  Did I tell you how creative they were?FREE Star Heads every Friday - Hell yeah!The Shop - It's free!Weapons - They look amazing!Behemoth will be forever flawless with their game titles and their gameplay.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
This Sure is Neato! 10/10Wow, what a game! Hi, I'm a man (or woman, whatever) who you don't know in real life, and I want to tell you what I think of this fantasitc product. Let me just preface this by saying how easy, and just, accessable this product is to use. As a busy, newly single parent of two, I hardly have any time to play modern computer games, what with their 500+ button combonations and 900+ hours of gameplay. It's tough to find a nice computer game that I can easily pick up and play for 15 minutes or so (but not around my young ones, it's a little inappropriate in my opinion), and then get back to my normal, repetitive, day by day life. But enough about me! You probably want to know why this game deserves your time, don't you? Of course you do, even I knew that. So I wrote this to tell you why you should pick this up (not really LOL. It would a digital download version of the game). Simply put: This game has a lot of content for it's price. Not only do you get decently sized, replayable campaign, you also get an insane (or "hardcore" as the hip kids say) mode, a few online arena game modes, numerous head customizations to unlock, and access to community made maps so the fun never ends. WOW! WHAT A BARGAIN!It sure is a whacky, zany game that you really should check out for yourself! You can believe in my words when I say that Battleblock Theater is a wonderful game that anyone should add to their library. Seriously, don't be a doof and not buy this game! You gotta be bonkers not to!4/5 Acorns

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												This has got to be one of the best games I ever played, but what else do you expect from Behemoth?The story is simple, funny, weird and I had no troubles understanding it (I normally don't care about the story of a game until I played through it), and it was also really funny! The ending is...well, you have to see it for yourself.Do I even need to say anything about the narrator? I don't I have to, he is one of my favorite narrators of all time now. He was the main reason I kept playing, just to hear him talk!The graphics are colorful and happy, and they really fit the silly mood of the game. The music is also excellent, some of the soundtracks have been burned into my skull, I just can't get them out of my head, especially the Secret level music and the Time Trial theme!The gameplay is excellent. I am not a huge fan of 2D puzzle games, but this one I love. It reminded me of "Professor Fizzwizzle", and that was one of my favorite puzzle games of all time! The puzzles are not too hard, the difficulty curve is steady and good, and you ALWAYS get prepared for what's ahead of you. Especially the last levels which are the hardest ones feel great when you finally beat them. Especially that stupid last Time Trial...I had to play it over and over, it was so frustrating because you had to do everything perfectly, but when I finally beat it...wow. It's just like old hardcore NES games, but fair!Each chapter had a certain theme, which I liked a lot, but I can't really recall any of the themes. One of the chapters I think was all about jumping around on the lava blocks (which are trampolines in this game and don't hurt you), another chapter had disappearing and reappearing blocks, so you'd have to time your jumps. I like that a lot, it was subtle and not too obvious, and it added a lot of variety to the already varied gameplay.I also like that the boss levels are Time Trials, and didn't have a huge monster that you have to fight, because the combat in this game is not as strong as the puzzles, so the time trials were a fantastic idea. The game also has some additional elements like unlockable characters (like 500 of them), weapons to help you with the game (GET THE NERF GUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN. It makes the game a 1000 times easier.), and even some additional levels of each chapter.All in all, this game gets an 8/8 for being, in my eyes, a perfect puzzle platformer. DEFINITELY buy it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												A platformer that is insanely addictive.The tone of the game and narrator are fun.The story sort of acts as a guide but the cutscenes are beautifully narrated and animated. The premise of the game is that you and a boatload (literally) of friends got shipwrecked and are kidnapped by a bunch of cats and forced to perform in their theater. The sountrack is very impressive and will leave you with a tune stuck in your head.The gameplay is great. First off you can customize your character in many different ways. This includes the shape of your head, your face, your color, and which weapons you choose. It is a platformer so the basics like double jump and powerups are there. A crap ton of levels are in the game (at the time of writing this review I have only beaten chapter 1 and 2. The completionist in me needs A++ on every level). It can be easy at times and harder at other times. If you are going for A++ you will want to throw your controller/keyboard at your moniter and take the remnants of your moniter and smash your computer with them. There is also an option for insane mode, but I haven't dared touch it yet.The muliplayer includes co-op (2 player) with the main story as well as a plethora of arena modes. Nobody is really playing them so a match can be hard to find. If you have three other friends who have the game it doesn't matter anyways as most, if not all, of the modes are only four players.Definetly recommended!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												It is to be expected that a game from the same team that brought us Castle Crashers is going to be filled to the brim with humor and other random silliness. I'd say they hit another nail in the head with this one. Unlike their previous title, this game is essentially a platformer but still has some forms of combat that often involves infinite hilarity and mayhem on both friend and foe.I can list the pros and cons but to be honest I don't think there's any con to this game whatsoever. There's a plethora of levels which you can play on normal or insane if you fancy more of a challenge and to prevent you from easily getting bored, it features a variety of game modes that can all be played solo, cooperatively and/or against friends or other players online. On top of that, the game includes a level editor integrated with the Steam Workshop to give the game even more replayability and every Friday a different playlist created by the community is chosen to be featured, which players can then play to gain extra gems/yarn and new prisoners. The items you collect in the game (gems, yarn, weapons and prisoners) can all be traded with anyone through either the in-game lobby or Steam's very own trading system, which means you can even trade against cards and items from other games. If all of that is not enough, the game's comedic value more than makes up for it.To sum it all up, the game is quite expansive with more than plenty of things to do, sights to see and stuff to collect in an environment that can be enjoyed by one and all. The game is definitely worth it's price and even if you're usually not into platformers, I'd say it's still worth a try as it offers a lot more than just platforming.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												This game is really solidly built and really fun, but damn if it doesn't slap you in the balls a couple of times. The art style is simple and nice to look at, the story is fantastic (it's basically a rescue the princess story with a Behemoth twist), and the music is... music to the ears! I really don't recommend the online multiplayer, because 9 times out of 10, your partner and/or you is going to have serious lag issues. Also, the AI of the bots in singleplayer versus is just... Eghhhhh... I think they have the same AI as the cats in the regular game, just slightly harder. They always have discs, no variation between their weapons. Sometimes, since they have perfect knowledge of what to do because they're soulless programs, they will pin you into a corner until you can actually god damn move. But either way, Battleblock Theater is a charming experience that you should definitely jump in to.I give this game 8 cats out of 10.

												Honestly, Behemoth is hands down the best video game company on earth. They have a refreshing sense of style and humor that shows in every one of their games (INB4 Game 4 is the same).
