number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												-Core Review-Gameplay . 8 (with friends 9) average = 8.5Music . 6Art . 8Mechanics . 9*bonusComedy . 9Total . 8.1-Nice Words-The game is a blast, a short and sweet adventure. Play by yourself or with friends. With it's extremely responsive mechanics and challenging maps this game is really fun. If you like platformers and laughing it is definitely the game for you. Music is fitting but not anything substantial. Art style is very comical and will have you giggling as you work your way through the maps.-Personal Experience-Honestly I'm already hooked on this game, and I've only been playing for about an hour. It has been an amazing hour of laughs and trying super hard to run through the levels as fast as I can collecting ALL the gems. The comedy is really well put, I think this game (by itself) has made me laugh more than any other game I've ever owned.The movement is what you would expect from a platformer, and there are plenty of hilarious obstacles. I also thought the level editor looked cool, haven't touched it.The Art looks like it came straight from the internet with all the funny lookin' faces.Also the narrators voice, and comedic timing is perfect, I should say.All in all it is a very enjoyable game by yourself, and much more fun with a good friend. Perfect for if you're tired of try-harding your balls off in the games you really want to be good at, and just want a break with some laughs.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												This game is incredible. Is it as great as the powerhouse Castle Crashers was? Perhaps. It's got the same humor as Castle Crashers, but amped up big time. This game feels like a behemoth game should.(I know I only have about 9 hours when I posted this review. I played it lots on the Xbox version though.)First off, the graphics. They may not seem impressive, but it's not just quality we are talking here. I'm talking about how the game looks, and it looks great. All of the prisoner heads have their own personality, and it's pretty awesome the diversity. Not just the prisoners have this personality though. The cat guards, for example, are cute and look friendly, although they can (and probably will!) kill you.But graphics aren't as important as gameplay. Good thing the gameplay here is great. In the game, you take part in nasty plays after crash landing on an island, in which you collect gems and balls of yarn. Playing single player isn't as much fun as multiplayer however. I'll be talking mostly about the multiplayer, which is pretty unique. It is a "co-optional" system in which you don't have to always help your partner, or you may need to kill them to progress. There are also many different weapon types you can use, each granting some cool abilities. You can use the pop-gun to fire a projectile at a wall that will stick there for you to jump on. You can also wield a primary and secondary weapon, which is a nice touch. There are 10 weapons in total. In addition, there is a fun arena battle mode consisting of many different modes you can play.On to the story. It is mostly told through cutscenes, but it isn't the kind of cutscene where once it starts, you think "ugh, another one?" instead, you'll be thinking, "Awesome! Another cutscene!" because they are just so funny. The narrator for the game, Will Stamper, also narrates these cutscenes.And, there is a level editor installed. It is easy to use, and is fun to work with aswell. Creating levels can be somewhat of a challenge if you aren't creative, however. But, this is what happens in any game with a level editor.And that'll wrap up my review. Sorry it was a little lengthy, but I had lots to say. It's a very fun game, and stays funny while doing it. If you want a score, it gets 9.5/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												This game is excellent.  If you like games like super meat boy then you will like this one.  It's not as hard as super meat boy, but it's a platformer that kind of reminds me of that game.The story and art are hilarious.  You get kidnapped by cats and are forced to perform for them on stage.  This is made by the same people that made Castle Crashers, so if you liked that game then the humor in this one is similar.  It looks hand drawn and is really high quality with the graphics.  You can choose from a whole ton of heads for your character, and you unlock more by playing the game.  The heads are really fun, and I spend just as much time choosing which one to use as playing the game itself.  The game is multiplayer either online or local.  It's best played with friends because you can throw your friends into a spike pit.  Enough said.  Watch for this game to come on sale.  It will frequently go from between 2 and 5 dollars.  At that price, there is no reason not to get it.  The game would run well on an Apple II probably so even if you have an old computer get it.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												After being a very large fan of Behemoth's game Castle Crashers, I loved this game. It is a great follow up to a great game. Can't wait for DLC! Beat the game in Normal mode, working through Insane mode, and playing a lot of Arena with randoms. I would recommend this game to any fan of Castle Crashers, or to fans of 2D beat-em-up games. With similar gameplay to Castle Crashers, a hilarious comentator, and a brilliant sound track, this would easily make my list of ten most infuriating games of all time, and ten best beat-em-ups. With gorgeous graphics, I can easily say that this game is one of my favorite games of all time. Looking forward to collecting all of the heads.
